summary: An employer cannot cancel and then restart a Compressed Work Week schedule just to avoid paying for a statutory holiday. If they do, employees will be paid under standard Day Work rules for up to 14 days after the schedule restarts.
logical_representation: IF schedule_cancelled_to_avoid_stat_holiday (llm) == true -> RECALCULATE_PAY(schedule_type='DAY_WORK') FOR MAX(14_DAYS)
hierarchy: Boilermaker Contractors Association>IBB Local 146>Maintenance Agreement Addendum
reasoning: This rule imposes a penalty by changing the pay calculation method if a schedule is manipulated, which directly affects how worked time is categorized and compensated.

name: CWW Night Shift Premium
rule_text: The shift premium on all compressed work week night shifts will be three dollars and fifty cents ($3.50) per hour for all straight time hours worked on shift.
summary: Employees working a night shift on a Compressed Work Week schedule receive an extra $3.50 for every straight-time hour worked.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == 'COMPRESSED_WORK_WEEK (llm)' AND shift_type == 'NIGHT' -> PREMIUM($3.50) FOR ST_HOURS
hierarchy: Boilermaker Contractors Association>IBB Local 146>Maintenance Agreement Addendum
reasoning: This rule specifies a monetary premium for working under specific conditions (night shift), which is a key component of calculating total pay for worked time.

name: Unpaid Lunch on 10-Hour Day Shifts
rule_text: When working ten (10) hours with two (2) fifteen (15) minute paid breaks and a half (1/2) hour lunch, the midday lunch period of one-half (1/2) hour on workdays of ten (10) hours or less between the hours of 7:30 a.m. and 7:30 p.m. will be unpaid.
summary: On day shifts of 10 hours or less, the 30-minute midday lunch break is unpaid. The two 15-minute breaks are paid.
logical_representation: IF daily_hours <= 10 AND shift_type == 'DAY' -> PAY(LUNCH_BREAK_30_MIN=UNPAID)
hierarchy: Boilermaker Contractors Association>IBB Local 146>Maintenance Agreement Addendum
reasoning: This rule defines whether a specific period (a lunch break) is paid or unpaid, which directly affects the calculation of total paid hours for the day.

name: Paid Breaks on 12-Hour Shifts
rule_text: In all other instances there shall be three (3) half hour (1/2) paid breaks per twelve (12) hour shifts.
summary: On 12-hour shifts, employees are entitled to three paid 30-minute breaks.
logical_representation: IF daily_hours == 12 -> PROVIDE(3_x_30_MIN_PAID_BREAKS)
hierarchy: Boilermaker Contractors Association>IBB Local 146>Maintenance Agreement Addendum
reasoning: This rule establishes an entitlement to paid breaks during the workday, which is a component of the total paid time for the shift.

name: Shift Change Pay Protection (Missed EDO)
rule_text: If an employee has started work during a normal work week Monday through Sunday, is then changed to a Compressed Work Week schedule and not given the required earned days off, they shall be paid straight time for the first forty (40) hours worked in the week at the applicable rate and overtime thereafter until the completion of the normal work week.
summary: If an employee is switched to a Compressed Work Week and misses their earned days off as a result, their pay for that week is calculated as straight time for the first 40 hours and overtime for all subsequent hours.
logical_representation: IF employee_status (Unsupported) == 'TRANSFER_TO_CWW' AND missed_edo (llm) == true -> PAY(WEEKLY_HOURS_UP_TO_40=ST, WEEKLY_HOURS_AFTER_40=OT)
hierarchy: Boilermaker Contractors Association>IBB Local 146>Maintenance Agreement Addendum
reasoning: This rule dictates how to categorize hours into straight time and overtime under a specific shift change scenario, making it a rule for processing worked time.

name: Lost Hours Pay Cap
rule_text: In no case will missed hours be paid if the employee works forty (40) or more straight time hours in the calendar week. If less than forty (40) hours is worked in the calendar week, missed hours on the initial schedule will be paid but only to the extent that straight time hours on the new schedule in the calendar week plus hours worked on the old schedule in the calendar week plus missed hours on the initial schedule does not exceed forty (40).
summary: Payment for lost hours due to a shift change is capped. An employee will not be paid for missed hours if they already worked 40 or more straight-time hours that week. If they worked less than 40 hours, they will only be paid for enough missed hours to bring their total straight-time hours for the week up to a maximum of 40.
logical_representation: IF employee_status (Unsupported) == 'TRANSFER' AND lost_hours (llm) > 0 -> CONSTRAINT(PAID_MISSED_HOURS_PLUS_WORKED_HOURS <= 40)
hierarchy: Boilermaker Contractors Association>IBB Local 146>Maintenance Agreement Addendum
reasoning: This rule places a limit on a pay entitlement (lost hours pay), directly affecting the final calculation of compensation for the work week.

name: 5x8 Schedule, Mon-Fri Overtime
rule_text:
| Day of Week   | Straight Time   | TimeandOneHalf (1.5x)   | DoubleTime (2x)   |
|---------------|-----------------|-------------------------|-------------------|
| Monday        | 8 hours         | Up to 2 hours           | After 10 hours    |
summary: On a 5x8 schedule, for Monday through Friday, the first 8 hours are paid at straight time, hours 9 and 10 are at time and a half, and any hours after 10 are at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '5x8' AND day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU', 'FRI'] -> PAY(HOURS_0_TO_8=ST, HOURS_8_TO_10=OT, AFTER(10)=DT)
hierarchy: Boilermaker Contractors Association>IBB Local 146>Maintenance Agreement Addendum
reasoning: This rule explicitly defines the thresholds for straight time, overtime, and double time on a standard work schedule, which is the core function of LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: 5x8 Schedule, Weekend & Holiday Overtime
rule_text:
| Day of Week   | Straight Time   | TimeandOneHalf (1.5x)   | DoubleTime (2x)   |
|---------------|-----------------|-------------------------|-------------------|
| Saturday      |                 |                         | All hours         |
| Sunday        |                 |                         | All hours         |
| Stat Holiday  |                 |                         | All hours         |
summary: On a 5x8 schedule, all hours worked on a Saturday, Sunday, or Statutory Holiday are paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '5x8' AND (day_of_week IN ['SAT', 'SUN'] OR is_stat_holiday == true) -> TRANSITION(DT)
hierarchy: Boilermaker Contractors Association>IBB Local 146>Maintenance Agreement Addendum
reasoning: This rule specifies the pay rate for special days (weekends and holidays), which is a key aspect of categorizing worked time for payroll.

name: 4x10 Mon-Thu Schedule, Regular Day Overtime
summary: On a 4x10 Monday-Thursday schedule, the first 10 hours on a regular workday (Mon-Thu) are paid at straight time, and all hours after 10 are paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10_mon-thu' AND day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU'] -> PAY(HOURS_0_TO_10=ST, AFTER(10)=DT)
hierarchy: Boilermaker Contractors Association>IBB Local 146>Maintenance Agreement Addendum
reasoning: This rule defines the straight time and double time thresholds for a specific compressed work week schedule, making it a LABOR_WORKED_TIME rule.

name: 4x10 Mon-Thu Schedule, Friday Overtime
rule_text:
| Day of Week   | Straight Time   | Time and One Half (1.5x)   | Double Time (2x)   |
|---------------|-----------------|----------------------------|--------------------|
| Friday        |                 | Up to 10 hours             | After 10 hours     |
summary: On a 4x10 Monday-Thursday schedule, the first 10 hours worked on a Friday are paid at time and a half, and all hours after 10 are paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10_mon-thu' AND day_of_week == 'FRI' -> PAY(HOURS_0_TO_10=OT, AFTER(10)=DT)
hierarchy: Boilermaker Contractors Association>IBB Local 146>Maintenance Agreement Addendum
reasoning: This rule specifies the overtime pay structure for a scheduled day off (Friday) on a 4x10 schedule, directly relating to the categorization of worked time.

name: 4x10 Tue-Fri Schedule, Regular Day Overtime
summary: On a 4x10 Tuesday-Friday schedule, the first 10 hours on a regular workday (Tue-Fri) are paid at straight time, and all hours after 10 are paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10_tue-fri' AND day_of_week IN ['TUE', 'WED', 'THU', 'FRI'] -> PAY(HOURS_0_TO_10=ST, AFTER(10)=DT)
hierarchy: Boilermaker Contractors Association>IBB Local 146>Maintenance Agreement Addendum
reasoning: This rule defines the straight time and double time thresholds for a specific compressed work week schedule, making it a LABOR_WORKED_TIME rule.

name: 4x10 Tue-Fri Schedule, Monday Overtime
rule_text:
| Day of Week   | Straight Time   | Time and One Half (1.5x)   | Double Time (2x)   |
|---------------|-----------------|----------------------------|--------------------|
| Monday        |                 | Up to 10 hours             | After 10 hours     |
summary: On a 4x10 Tuesday-Friday schedule, the first 10 hours worked on a Monday are paid at time and a half, and all hours after 10 are paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10_tue-fri' AND day_of_week == 'MON' -> PAY(HOURS_0_TO_10=OT, AFTER(10)=DT)
hierarchy: Boilermaker Contractors Association>IBB Local 146>Maintenance Agreement Addendum
reasoning: This rule specifies the overtime pay structure for a scheduled day off (Monday) on a 4x10 schedule, directly relating to the categorization of worked time.

name: CF Industries SDO Schedule Pay
rule_text: Employees will be paid in full for all hours worked each week. (For example, if someone completes the regular 8-9-9-8-8 schedule, they will be compensated for forty-two (42) hours at the regular straight time hourly rate and all required contributions under the collective agreement will be compensated based upon fort-two (42) hours.
summary: At CF Industries, employees on the special 8-9-9-8-8 schedule are paid for 42 straight-time hours for a completed work week.
logical_representation: IF project_location (Unsupported) == 'CF_INDUSTRIES' AND schedule_type == '8-9-9-8-8_mon-fri' -> PAY(weekly_hours=42_ST)
hierarchy: Boilermaker Contractors Association>IBB Local 146>Maintenance Agreement Addendum
reasoning: This rule defines the total weekly straight time hours for a unique, site-specific schedule, which is a core component of calculating pay for worked time.

name: CF Industries SDO Pay on Day Off
rule_text: All work on the SDO will be paid in accordance with the number of hours an individual employee has worked since the last SDO. For example: if an individual has worked three (3) of the scheduled nine (9) hour days and are asked to work an SDO, the first five (5) hours on the schedule will be paid at the straight time rate and all additional hours will be compensated at the appropriate overtime rate as per the collective agreement.
summary: At CF Industries, pay for working a Scheduled Day Off (SDO) depends on hours already worked in the pay cycle. The employee is paid straight time until they reach the 42-hour weekly threshold, and any hours beyond that are paid at the applicable overtime rate.
logical_representation: IF project_location (Unsupported) == 'CF_INDUSTRIES' AND schedule_type == '8-9-9-8-8_mon-fri' AND is_sdo (llm) == true -> PAY(ST_HOURS = MAX(0, 42 - hours_worked_since_last_sdo (llm)), OT_HOURS = daily_hours - ST_HOURS)
hierarchy: Boilermaker Contractors Association>IBB Local 146>Maintenance Agreement Addendum
reasoning: This rule sets out a specific, conditional calculation for determining the split between straight time and overtime hours, which is a clear function of categorizing worked time for payroll.

name: Weekly Pay Day
rule_text: Wages will be paid weekly by cheque or other legal tender by the end of the work day on Thursday.
summary: Employees will be paid their weekly wages by the end of the workday every Thursday.
logical_representation: PAYMENT_DUE(WEEKLY, by=EOD_THU)
reasoning: This rule establishes the schedule for paying employees for their worked time, which is a fundamental aspect of labor compensation.

name: Second Shift Pay Day
rule_text: If there is a second shift the weekly cheques will be distributed by the end of the work day Wednesday if available on site.
summary: For employees on a second shift, weekly paycheques will be distributed by the end of the day on Wednesday, provided the cheques are available on site.
logical_representation: IF shift_type == 'SECOND_SHIFT' AND payment_available_on_site (llm) == true -> PAYMENT_DUE(WEEKLY, by=EOD_WED)
reasoning: This rule is an exception to the standard pay schedule based on shift, directly governing the timing of payment for worked hours.

name: Foreperson ICCS Premium
rule_text: General Forepersons and Forepersons who have achieved the status of Industrial Construction Crew Supervisor designation from the Alberta Apprenticeship Industry Training will receive an additional one dollar and fifty cents ($1.50) over the regular General Forepersons and Forepersons rates (for all hours worked) contained in the applicable reference agreement. The premium is not to be pyramided.
summary: General Forepersons and Forepersons with an Industrial Construction Crew Supervisor (ICCS) designation receive a non-pyramiding premium of $1.50 per hour on top of their regular rate.
logical_representation: IF is_foreman == true AND certification (llm) == 'ICCS' -> PREMIUM($1.50, non_pyramiding=true)
reasoning: This rule establishes a specific monetary premium paid per hour worked based on an employee's role and certification, directly affecting labor cost and pay.

name: Employer Fund Contributions
rule_text:
Employers will make appropriate contributions to the following funds for those participating trades which  have  the  provision  contained  within  their  respective  Industrial  Construction  Reference Agreement:
- o Building Trades of Alberta
- o Audiometric Testing
- o Construction Employee Family Assistance Program (CEFAP)
- o Case Managed Aftercare (CMAC)
- o Rapid Site Access Program (RSAP)
- o Workforce Development Trust Fund (WFDT)
summary: Employers must contribute to various funds (such as Building Trades of Alberta, CEFAP, etc.) for trades where the relevant Industrial Construction Reference Agreement requires it.
logical_representation: IF reference_agreement_provision (llm) == true for position_classification -> EMPLOYER_CONTRIBUTION(fund_name (llm))
reasoning: This rule defines employer-paid benefits that are calculated based on employee trade and hours worked, forming part of the overall labor compensation package.

name: Alloy Welder Premium on Dispatch
rule_text: Alloy welders with a valid alloy welding certificate will be paid an additional premium of three dollars and twenty-five cents ($3.25) per hour worked if certification was a requirement for dispatch.
summary: If an alloy welding certificate was required for the job, welders with that certificate will receive a premium of $3.25 for each hour worked.
logical_representation: IF position_classification == 'ALLOY_WELDER' AND certification (llm) == 'ALLOY_WELDING' AND dispatch_requirement (llm) == true -> PREMIUM($3.25)
reasoning: This rule defines a specific monetary premium per hour worked based on skill and job requirements, directly impacting the calculation of pay for worked time.

name: Reclassification to Alloy Welder
rule_text: If a welder on site who was not dispatched as an alloy welder, but has the certification, or is requested to  be  certified  by  the  employer  and  is  requested  to  perform  alloy  welding,  the  worker  will  be  reclassified as an alloy welder and paid the alloy welder premium from the date of re-classification.
summary: A welder not originally dispatched for alloy work will be reclassified as an alloy welder and receive the corresponding pay premium from the date they are asked to perform alloy welding, provided they have or get the required certification.
logical_representation: IF position_classification == 'WELDER' AND certification (llm) == 'ALLOY_WELDING' AND work_performed (llm) == 'ALLOY_WELDING' -> RECLASSIFY('ALLOY_WELDER') AND PAY_PREMIUM(from=reclassification_date (llm))
reasoning: This rule governs how an employee's classification and pay rate change based on the type of work performed, which is a key aspect of worked time compensation.

name: List of Recognized Statutory Holidays
rule_text:
11.100 The following days will constitute the recognized holidays within the terms of this Agreement.

| 1. New Years Day   | 6. Civic Holiday                           | 11. Christmas Day                          |
|--------------------|--------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------|
| 2. Family Day      | 7. Labour Day                              | 12. Boxing Day                             |
| 3. Good Friday     | 8. National Day for Truth & Reconciliation | 8. National Day for Truth & Reconciliation |
| 4. Victoria Day    | 9. Thanksgiving Day                        | 9. Thanksgiving Day                        |
| 5. Canada Day      | 10. Remembrance Day                        | 10. Remembrance Day                        |
summary: This rule lists the 12 officially recognized statutory holidays covered by the agreement: New Year's Day, Family Day, Good Friday, Victoria Day, Canada Day, Civic Holiday, Labour Day, National Day for Truth & Reconciliation, Thanksgiving Day, Remembrance Day, Christmas Day, and Boxing Day.
logical_representation: DEFINE is_stat_holiday = ['New Years Day', 'Family Day', 'Good Friday', 'Victoria Day', 'Canada Day', 'Civic Holiday', 'Labour Day', 'National Day for Truth & Reconciliation', 'Thanksgiving Day', 'Remembrance Day', 'Christmas Day', 'Boxing Day']
reasoning: This rule defines which specific days are classified as statutory holidays, a fundamental component for determining special pay rates and time off, which falls under the category of how labor time is categorized and compensated.

name: Automatic Recognition of New Government Holidays
rule_text: Any other  holiday  proclaimed  by  either  the  Provincial  or  Federal  Government  will  be  automatically recognized within this Agreement.
summary: If the Provincial or Federal Government proclaims a new public holiday, it will be automatically added to the list of recognized statutory holidays under this agreement.
logical_representation: IF government_proclaimed_holiday (llm) == true -> ADD_TO_LIST(is_stat_holiday)
reasoning: This rule expands the definition of what constitutes a statutory holiday, directly impacting pay and scheduling. This is a core aspect of labor time management.

name: Default Holiday Observance on Calendar Day
rule_text: Each of the recognized holidays listed in Article 12.100 shall be observed on the calendar day on which it occurs.
summary: By default, all statutory holidays are to be observed on their actual calendar date.
logical_representation: IF is_stat_holiday == true -> OBSERVE_ON(calendar_date)
reasoning: This rule establishes the default timing for holiday observance, which is essential for scheduling and determining which day receives special pay treatment. It is part of categorizing worked time.

name: Holiday Pay or Day Off at Company Discretion
rule_text: On the day of observance, the Company may either pay the workforce at double-time (2) the total package straight time hourly rate or provide the day off.
summary: On a statutory holiday, the company has the option to either pay employees double their straight-time hourly rate for working or give them the day off.
logical_representation: IF is_stat_holiday == true -> CHOOSE(PAY(2.0), PROVIDE(day_off))
reasoning: This rule explicitly defines the pay rate (double time) or entitlement (day off) for a statutory holiday, which is a core function of categorizing and compensating labor time.

name: Reporting Pay Minimum
rule_text: When an employee reports for work, unless previously advised there is no work available, they shall be entitled to two (2) hours pay at the appropriate day or shift rate.
summary: An employee who reports for their shift, without being told in advance not to, is guaranteed a minimum of two hours of pay at their applicable rate.
logical_representation: IF prior_notification_of_no_work (llm) == false -> MIN(2_HOURS_PAY)
reasoning: This rule establishes a minimum payment guarantee (show-up time) for employees who report to work, which is a fundamental aspect of defining payable time.

name: Payment for Time Worked or Waited on Site
rule_text: Should the employee start work or be required to wait at the jobsite, they shall be paid for hours worked or actual waiting time past the two (2) hours minimum.
summary: If an employee who reports to work either starts their job or is required to wait, they will be paid for all the time they worked or waited. The total hours paid will be the greater of the actual time on site (working or waiting) or the two-hour minimum.
logical_representation: IF work_commenced (Unsupported) == true OR is_required_to_wait (llm) == true -> PAY(MAX(2, daily_hours))
reasoning: This rule defines how payable hours are calculated when an employee starts work or waits on site, ensuring their compensation is at least the two-hour reporting minimum. It directly governs the calculation of paid time.

name: Initial and Terminal Travel Allowance (120-300km, eff 2025)
rule_text: As of May 4, 2025, Initial and terminal travel which will be paid as follows from the above: | 120-200 Radius Kilometers 200-300 Radius Kilometers | $ 116.00 each way, $ 166.00 each way, |
summary: Effective May 4, 2025, employees receive an initial and terminal travel allowance of $116 each way for projects 120-200km away, and $166 each way for projects 200-300km away.
logical_representation: IF validity_start_date >= '2025-05-04' AND project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) >= 120 AND project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) <= 200 -> ALLOWANCE(116.00, each_way); IF validity_start_date >= '2025-05-04' AND project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) > 200 AND project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) <= 300 -> ALLOWANCE(166.00, each_way)
reasoning: This defines a specific travel allowance based on distance and effective date, which is a key component of subsistence and remote work compensation.

name: Initial and Terminal Travel for Remote Sites (>475km, eff 2025)
rule_text: As of May 4, 2025, on jobs beyond the four hundred and seventy-five (475) radius kilometers initial  and  terminal  travel  amounts  will  be  mutually  agreed  between  the  Union  and  the Employer to a maximum of $455.00 each way or airfare if suitable proof of air transport is provided to the Employer.
summary: Effective May 4, 2025, for jobs over 475 km away, initial and terminal travel pay is mutually agreed upon, up to a maximum of $455 each way, or the cost of airfare with proof.
logical_representation: IF validity_start_date >= '2025-05-04' AND project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) > 475 -> ALLOWANCE(MUTUALLY_AGREED, MAX(455.00_each_way)) OR PAY(AIRFARE, with_proof)
reasoning: This rule outlines a special travel allowance for very remote projects, a key aspect of subsistence compensation.

name: Standard Work Day, 5x8 Schedule
rule_text: Eight (8) hours per day shall constitute a day's work and forty (40) hours per week, Monday to Friday inclusive, shall constitute a week's work.
summary: A standard workday is 8 hours, and a standard workweek is 40 hours, from Monday to Friday.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '5x8' -> SET(daily_hours_ST=8, weekly_hours_ST=40, work_days=['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU', 'FRI'])
reasoning: This rule defines the standard hours of work for a specific schedule, which is fundamental to categorizing worked time.

name: Standard Work Day Timings, 5x8 Schedule
rule_text: The regular starting time shall be eight (8) o'clock a.m., and the regular quitting time shall be four-thirty (4:30) o'clock p.m. Start times may be staggered two (2) hours between 7:00 a.m. and 9:00 a.m. as job conditions warrant.
summary: The standard workday is 8:00 AM to 4:30 PM, but start times can be staggered between 7:00 AM and 9:00 AM if needed for the job.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '5x8' -> SET(shift_start_time='08:00', shift_end_time='16:30', start_time_flexibility=['07:00'-'09:00'])
reasoning: This rule specifies the timing of the workday, which directly relates to how hours are counted and categorized.

name: Optional Work Week, 4x10 Schedule
rule_text: As an option, ten (10) hours per day, Monday to Thursday or Tuesday to Friday may be worked at straight time.
summary: An optional 4-day, 10-hour work week (Monday-Thursday or Tuesday-Friday) can be implemented where all 10 hours are paid at straight time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10_mon-thu' OR schedule_type == '4x10_tue-fri' -> SET(daily_hours_ST=10)
reasoning: This rule defines an alternative work schedule and its straight time hours, a core component of categorizing worked time.

name: 4x10 Schedule Establishment
rule_text: The ten (10) hour system must operate for a minimum period of four (4) consecutive days before it is established as the regular hours of work. Once established it becomes the regular hours of work for those so assigned.
summary: A 4-day, 10-hour schedule must be followed for at least four consecutive days to be officially considered the regular work schedule for the assigned employees.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10' AND shift_consecutive_days >= 4 -> SET(schedule_is_established=true)
reasoning: This rule sets the condition for when a work schedule becomes official, which impacts how pay and overtime are calculated.

name: 4x10 Schedule Union Notification
rule_text: When establishing a four (4) day ten (10) hour work week, the Employer will advise the affected Local Union office that a four (4) day ten (10) hour option is in place and declare if it is a Monday to Thursday, or Tuesday to Friday work pattern.
summary: When a 4-day, 10-hour work week is established, the employer must notify the local union office and specify whether it's a Monday-Thursday or Tuesday-Friday schedule.
logical_representation: IF event (Unsupported) == 'ESTABLISH_4x10' -> ACTION(NOTIFY_UNION(schedule_type))
reasoning: This is a procedural rule tied to the establishment of work schedules, which is classified under worked time.

name: Short Term Work on 4x10 Projects
rule_text: Where a multi trade project is scheduled under the four (4) ten (10) hour shift system and an Employer secures short term work that may not provide for forty (40) hours of work, all hours worked shall be paid for in keeping with the provisions applicable to the four (4) ten (10) hour shift.
summary: On a multi-trade project using a 4-day, 10-hour schedule, if an employee works on a short-term job with less than 40 hours available, all hours worked are still paid according to the 4x10 overtime rules.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10' AND project_type == 'MULTI_TRADE' AND weekly_hours < 40 -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('4x10')
reasoning: This rule dictates how to apply pay rules under specific conditions (short-term work on a 4x10 schedule), directly affecting the calculation of worked time.

name: Paid Breaks on 10-Hour Shifts
rule_text: When ten (10) hour shifts are worked, in lieu of the work breaks and lunch breaks provided herein, the Employer shall have the option of scheduling two breaks of one half (½) hour each, paid at the applicable rate, approximately equally spaced in the ten (10) hour shift.
summary: On 10-hour shifts, the employer can provide two paid 30-minute breaks, roughly evenly spaced, instead of the usual breaks.
logical_representation: IF daily_hours == 10 -> PROVIDE(2 x 30_minute_paid_breaks)
reasoning: This rule defines paid break entitlements, which are a component of the total hours paid and thus fall under worked time.

name: Day Shift Definition
rule_text: Employees working a day shift defined as a shift starting at 8:00 a.m. shall work eight (8) hours for eight (8) hours pay.
summary: A day shift is defined as starting at 8:00 AM, where employees work 8 hours and are paid for 8 hours.
logical_representation: IF shift_type == 'DAY' AND shift_start_time (llm) == '08:00' -> PAY(8_hours_ST) FOR WORK(8_hours)
reasoning: This rule defines what constitutes a standard day shift and its pay, a fundamental aspect of categorizing worked time.

name: Shift Premium for Non-Daywork
rule_text: Employees working any shift that is outside of daywork conditions, shall receive a shift premium of four dollars and fifty cents ($4.50) per hour worked.
summary: Employees who work shifts that are not considered standard day shifts will receive an extra $4.50 per hour.
logical_representation: IF shift_type != 'DAY' -> PREMIUM($4.50)
reasoning: This rule specifies a premium payment based on the type of shift worked, which is a key part of calculating pay for worked time.

name: Overtime, 5x8 Schedule, Daily OT
rule_text: Monday ... Friday | 8 hours | Up to 2 hours | After 10 hours
summary: On a 5-day, 8-hour schedule from Monday to Friday, the first 8 hours are straight time, the next 2 hours are time and a half, and any hours worked beyond 10 are double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '5x8' AND day_of_week IN ['MON','TUE','WED','THU','FRI'] -> (IF daily_hours <= 8 -> PAY(ST)) AND (IF daily_hours > 8 AND daily_hours <= 10 -> PAY(OT)) AND (IF daily_hours > 10 -> PAY(DT))
reasoning: This rule explicitly defines the thresholds for straight time, overtime, and double time on weekdays for a standard 5x8 schedule.

name: Overtime, 5x8 Schedule, Weekend & Holiday
rule_text:
Saturday | | | All hours
Sunday | | | All hours
Stat Holiday | | | All hours
summary: On a 5-day, 8-hour schedule, all hours worked on a Saturday, Sunday, or Statutory Holiday are paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '5x8' AND (day_of_week IN ['SAT', 'SUN'] OR is_stat_holiday == true) -> PAY(DT)
reasoning: This rule specifies the pay rate for non-standard workdays (weekends, holidays), which is a core function of categorizing worked time.

name: Overtime, 4x10 Mon-Thu Schedule, Weekdays
rule_text:
Monday to Thursday:
Monday ... Thursday | 10 hours | | After 10 hours
Friday | | Up to 10 hours | After 10 hours
summary: On a 4-day, 10-hour (Mon-Thu) schedule: work on Mon-Thu is straight time for the first 10 hours and double time after. Work on Friday is time and a half for the first 10 hours and double time after.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10_mon-thu' -> (IF day_of_week IN ['MON','TUE','WED','THU'] AND daily_hours > 10 -> PAY(DT)) AND (IF day_of_week == 'FRI' AND daily_hours <= 10 -> PAY(OT)) AND (IF day_of_week == 'FRI' AND daily_hours > 10 -> PAY(DT))
reasoning: This rule defines the specific overtime thresholds and rates for a 4x10 Monday-Thursday schedule, directly related to categorizing worked time.

name: Overtime, 4x10 Mon-Thu Schedule, Weekend & Holiday
rule_text:
Saturday | | | All hours
Sunday | | | All hours
Stat Holiday | | | All hours
summary: On a 4-day, 10-hour (Mon-Thu) schedule, all hours worked on a Saturday, Sunday, or Statutory Holiday are paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10_mon-thu' AND (day_of_week IN ['SAT', 'SUN'] OR is_stat_holiday == true) -> PAY(DT)
reasoning: This rule specifies the pay rate for non-standard workdays (weekends, holidays) for a 4x10 schedule, which is a core function of categorizing worked time.

name: Overtime, 4x10 Tue-Fri Schedule, Weekdays
rule_text:
Tuesday to Friday:
Monday | | Up to 10 hours | After 10 hours
Tuesday ... Friday | 10 hours | | After 10 hours
summary: On a 4-day, 10-hour (Tue-Fri) schedule: work on Tue-Fri is straight time for the first 10 hours and double time after. Work on Monday is time and a half for the first 10 hours and double time after.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10_tue-fri' -> (IF day_of_week IN ['TUE','WED','THU','FRI'] AND daily_hours > 10 -> PAY(DT)) AND (IF day_of_week == 'MON' AND daily_hours <= 10 -> PAY(OT)) AND (IF day_of_week == 'MON' AND daily_hours > 10 -> PAY(DT))
reasoning: This rule defines the specific overtime thresholds and rates for a 4x10 Tuesday-Friday schedule, directly related to categorizing worked time.

name: Overtime, 4x10 Tue-Fri Schedule, Weekend & Holiday
rule_text:
Saturday | | | All hours
Sunday | | | All hours
Stat Holiday | | | All hours
summary: On a 4-day, 10-hour (Tue-Fri) schedule, all hours worked on a Saturday, Sunday, or Statutory Holiday are paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10_tue-fri' AND (day_of_week IN ['SAT', 'SUN'] OR is_stat_holiday == true) -> PAY(DT)
reasoning: This rule specifies the pay rate for non-standard workdays (weekends, holidays) for a 4x10 schedule, which is a core function of categorizing worked time.

name: First Overtime Meal Break
rule_text: When an employee works beyond ten (10) hours per day they shall be entitled to a meal break and a meal supplied by the Company.
summary: An employee is entitled to a meal and a meal break, provided by the company, when they work more than 10 hours in a day.
logical_representation: IF daily_hours > 10 -> PROVIDE(meal_and_break)
reasoning: This rule establishes the primary trigger (working beyond 10 hours) for a meal entitlement, which is the core definition of a meal allowance rule.

name: Subsequent Overtime Meal Breaks
rule_text: The meal break will be provided after ten (10) hours of work and subsequent meal breaks each four (4) hours thereafter.
summary: After the first meal break at 10 hours, an employee is entitled to another meal break every four hours they continue to work.
logical_representation: IF daily_overtime_hours > 2 -> PROVIDE(meal_and_break) AND PROVIDE(meal_and_break) EVERY 4_hours_thereafter
reasoning: This rule defines the recurring entitlement for meal breaks during extended overtime, making it a meal allowance rule.

name: Overtime Meal Break Extension, 4x10 Schedule
rule_text: When the four (4) ten (10) hour day option is worked, recognizing emergency situations will arise, if the Company has not scheduled in excess of the ten (10) hour shift, the Company shall be granted a one (1) hour extension where a meal and meal break are not required.
summary: On a 4-day, 10-hour schedule, if overtime was not pre-scheduled, the company can have an employee work up to 11 hours before a meal and break are required.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10' AND overtime_type == 'UNSCHEDULED' -> SET(meal_break_trigger_hours=11)
reasoning: This rule modifies the trigger for a meal entitlement based on the work schedule and overtime type, classifying it under meal allowances.

name: Scheduled Overtime Meal Break Trigger
rule_text: When an employee works Scheduled Overtime (work performed on Saturdays, Sundays and Holidays they shall be entitled to a meal break when overtime work exceeds ten (10) hours.
summary: For scheduled overtime on Saturdays, Sundays, and holidays, an employee gets a meal break after working more than 10 hours.
logical_representation: IF overtime_type == 'SCHEDULED' AND (day_of_week IN ['SAT', 'SUN'] OR is_stat_holiday == true) AND daily_hours > 10 -> PROVIDE(meal_break)
reasoning: This rule specifies the conditions (day of week, hours worked) for a meal break entitlement during scheduled overtime, clearly making it a meal allowance rule.

name: Call-Out Overtime Meal Break Trigger
rule_text: When an employee works Short Notice Emergency Call-Out Overtime (overtime work performed other than continuous with the regular work day or Scheduled Overtime) they shall be entitled to a meal break when overtime work exceeds four (4) hours.
summary: For emergency call-out overtime, an employee is entitled to a meal break after working more than 4 hours.
logical_representation: IF overtime_type == 'CALL_OUT' AND daily_hours > 4 -> PROVIDE(meal_break)
reasoning: This rule defines a specific trigger (4 hours on call-out) for a meal entitlement, placing it in the meal allowance category.

name: Foreman Extra Hours Meal Exclusion
rule_text: When a foreperson is required to: 1) Start up to one (1) hour earlier, or 2) Finish up to one (1) hour later, or 3) Start up to one-half (1/2) hour earlier and finish up to one-half (1/2) hour later than the foreperson's crews, for the purposes of organizing work, obtaining permits or facilitating a transition to another shift, the foreperson shall not be entitled to a meal or meal break as per Clause 16.600 unless those provisions are applicable to the rest of the crew.
summary: A foreman who works up to an hour before or after their crew for prep work is not entitled to an overtime meal unless the rest of the crew also qualifies for one.
logical_representation: IF is_foreman == true AND extra_prep_hours <= 1 AND crew_meal_entitlement == false -> FORFEIT(meal_break)
reasoning: This rule creates an exclusion for meal entitlements based on an employee's role (foreman) and work pattern, making it a meal allowance rule.

name: Call-Out Pay Rate
rule_text: All hours worked beyond the minimum two (2) hour threshold will be paid at double (2x) the straight time total package hourly rate.
summary: On a call-out, any hours worked beyond the two-hour minimum are also paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF event (Unsupported) == 'CALL_OUT' AND daily_hours > 2 -> PAY(DT)
reasoning: This rule defines the pay rate for hours worked during a call-out, directly impacting how that time is compensated.

name: 12-Hour Shift Pay on 4x10 Base
rule_text: 4 x 10 Monday to Thursday or Tuesday to Friday: 10 hours @ straight time, 2 hours @ doubletime (2x)
summary: When a 12-hour turnaround shift is based on a 4x10 schedule, it is paid as 10 hours of straight time and 2 hours of double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '12_hour_turnaround' AND base_schedule == '4x10' -> PAY(10_hours_ST, 2_hours_DT)
reasoning: This rule explicitly defines how hours are categorized into pay buckets (ST, DT) for a specific shift type, which is the definition of a worked time rule.

name: 12-Hour Shift Pay on 5x8 Base
rule_text: 5 x 8 Monday to Friday: 8 hours @ straight time, 2 hours at time and one half (1 ½), 2 hours at doubletime (2x)
summary: When a 12-hour turnaround shift is based on a 5x8 schedule, it is paid as 8 hours of straight time, 2 hours of time and a half, and 2 hours of double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '12_hour_turnaround' AND base_schedule == '5x8' -> PAY(8_hours_ST, 2_hours_OT, 2_hours_DT)
reasoning: This rule explicitly defines how hours are categorized into pay buckets (ST, OT, DT) for a specific shift type, which is the definition of a worked time rule.

name: 12-Hour Shift Weekend & Holiday Pay
rule_text: Any hours worked on Saturday, Sunday or Holidays will be paid at the applicable overtime rates, as per the General Presidents' Maintenance Agreement (GPMA).
summary: On a 12-hour turnaround shift, any work on a Saturday, Sunday, or Holiday is paid at the overtime rates defined in the GPMA.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '12_hour_turnaround' AND (day_of_week IN ['SAT', 'SUN'] OR is_stat_holiday == true) -> PAY(applicable_GPMA_overtime_rate)
reasoning: This rule specifies the pay rate for work on special days (weekends, holidays) for a particular shift type, classifying it under worked time.

name: CWW Normal Work Day and Week
rule_text: The  parties  to  this  Agreement  agree  that  the  maximum  of  nine  (9)  hours  shall constitute  a  normal  days  work  beginning  at  7:30  a.m.  and  ending  at  5:00  p.m. (excluding a one-half hour (1/2) lunch break) may be utilized if restricted to Long Term Base Crew Employees. ... the maximum normal work week shall be forty-five (45) hours beginning Monday at 7:30 a.m. and ending Friday at 5:00 p.m.
summary: For Long Term Base Crew Employees on the Compressed Work Week, a normal workday is 9 hours and a normal workweek is 45 hours, Monday to Friday.
logical_representation: IF employee_type (llm) == 'LONG_TERM_BASE_CREW' -> SET(schedule_type='5x9_mon-fri') AND SET(daily_hours_ST=9) AND SET(weekly_hours_ST=45)
hierarchy: Suncor Refinery, Edmonton, Alberta>Edmonton Exchanger>National Maintenance Agreement for Alberta
reasoning: This rule defines the standard straight-time hours for a specific work schedule and employee group, which is a core component of LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Short-Term Employee Pay for 9th Hour
rule_text: It  is  understood  that  when  employees  are  hired  with  the  intentions  of  short-term employment (defined as less than six (6) weeks from the date of hire) that they will be paid in the following manner. During this six (6) week period, employees will be paid time and one-half (1 1/2) for the ninth (9th) hour.
summary: Employees hired for short-term employment (less than six weeks) are paid time and a half for the ninth hour worked each day.
logical_representation: IF employee_type (llm) == 'SHORT_TERM' AND employment_term_weeks (llm) < 6 AND daily_hours > 8 -> PAY(1.5x) FOR daily_hours BETWEEN 8 AND 9
hierarchy: Suncor Refinery, Edmonton, Alberta>Edmonton Exchanger>National Maintenance Agreement for Alberta
reasoning: This rule specifies an overtime condition (pay at time and a half) based on daily hours worked for a specific employee category, which is a fundamental aspect of LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Plant Shutdown Schedule for Short-Term Employees
rule_text: During a period of Plant Shutdown, all employees hired with the intentions of shortterm employment shall be paid based on five (5) eight (8) hour days Monday to Friday or four (4) ten (10) hour days Monday to Thursday and or Tuesday to Friday.
summary: During a Plant Shutdown, short-term employees will work either a 5x8 (Mon-Fri) schedule or a 4x10 (Mon-Thu or Tue-Fri) schedule.
logical_representation: IF event (Unsupported) == 'PLANT_SHUTDOWN' AND employee_type (llm) == 'SHORT_TERM' -> APPLY_SCHEDULE(schedule_type = '5x8' OR schedule_type = '4x10_mon-thu' OR schedule_type = '4x10_tue-fri')
hierarchy: Suncor Refinery, Edmonton, Alberta>Edmonton Exchanger>National Maintenance Agreement for Alberta
reasoning: This rule defines the specific work schedules applicable to a group of employees during a special event, which is a primary determinant of how worked time is calculated.

name: Coker Shift Rotation Grandfathering
rule_text: The parties  agree  to  "grandfather"  the  current  coker  shift  rotation  that  is  in  place  and operating  at  the  site  under  the  current  arrangements  and  rules.  This  would  apply  to members of Labourers Local 92 currently involved in this rotation.
summary: The existing coker shift rotation for members of Labourers Local 92 is grandfathered and continues to operate under its current rules.
logical_representation: IF position_classification == 'LABOURER' AND union_local (Unsupported) == '92' AND site_area (llm) == 'COKER' -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('EXISTING_COKER_SHIFT')
hierarchy: Suncor Refinery, Edmonton, Alberta>Edmonton Exchanger>National Maintenance Agreement for Alberta
reasoning: This rule mandates the continued application of a specific set of work schedule and pay rules for a defined group of employees, making it a LABOR_WORKED_TIME rule.

name: 9/80 Schedule Overtime Reference
rule_text: (See overtime provisions below for the 9/80 Schedule)
summary: For the specified locations (Shell Scotford and IOL Strathcona), the overtime provisions for the 9/80 schedule, as detailed elsewhere, must be applied.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '9/80' AND project_location (Unsupported) IN ['SHELL_SCOTFORD', 'IOL_STRATHCONA'] -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('9/80_OVERTIME')
reasoning: This rule directs that specific overtime provisions are to be used for the 9/80 schedule. Overtime calculations are a core function of categorizing worked time, making LABOR_WORKED_TIME the correct topic.

name: 9/80 Schedule Definition and Scope
rule_text: This work week averages to forty (40) hours straight time over a two-week period and is generally known as the 9/80 schedule. It is intended for on-going work and does not operate in 'major shutdown' situations.
summary: The 9/80 schedule is a two-week work cycle averaging 40 hours per week. This schedule is intended for ongoing work and is not applicable during major shutdowns.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '9/80' -> CONSTRAINT(event (Unsupported) != 'PLANT_SHUTDOWN')
reasoning: This rule defines the work schedule and its operational constraints, which are foundational to categorizing and calculating work time.

name: 9/80 Schedule, Week 1 Regular Hours
rule_text: The regular work week will consist of four (4) nine (9) hour straight time days Monday to Thursday and one (1) eight (8) hour straight time day on Friday in the first week.
summary: In the first week of a 9/80 schedule, the regular work day consists of 9 straight-time hours from Monday to Thursday, and 8 straight-time hours on Friday.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '9/80' AND week_number (Unsupported) == 1 AND day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU'] -> MAX(9_HOURS_ST) AND IF schedule_type == '9/80' AND week_number (Unsupported) == 1 AND day_of_week == 'FRI' -> MAX(8_HOURS_ST)
reasoning: This rule establishes the daily straight time hour limits for the first week of the schedule, which is a core component of worked time calculation.

name: 9/80 Schedule, Week 2 Regular Hours
rule_text: The regular work week will consist of four (4) nine (9) hour straight time days Monday to Thursday in the second week. Friday is a day off.
summary: In the second week of a 9/80 schedule, the regular work day consists of 9 straight-time hours from Monday to Thursday. Friday is a scheduled day off.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '9/80' AND week_number (Unsupported) == 2 AND day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU'] -> MAX(9_HOURS_ST) AND IF schedule_type == '9/80' AND week_number (Unsupported) == 2 AND day_of_week == 'FRI' -> EDO
reasoning: This rule establishes the daily straight time hour limits and the earned day off for the second week of the schedule, directly impacting time categorization.

name: 9/80 Schedule, Week 1 Weekday Overtime
rule_text: Week 1 Time and one half (1 ½) for the first two hours (2) worked before or after the regular nine (9) or eight (8) hours day Monday to Friday-doubletime (2x) will be paid thereafter.
summary: During Week 1 of a 9/80 schedule (Monday-Friday), the first two overtime hours beyond the regular daily hours are paid at time and a half. All subsequent overtime hours are paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '9/80' AND week_number (Unsupported) == 1 AND day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU', 'FRI'] AND daily_overtime_hours <= 2 -> PREMIUM(1.5) AND IF schedule_type == '9/80' AND week_number (Unsupported) == 1 AND day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU', 'FRI'] AND daily_overtime_hours > 2 -> TRANSITION(DT)
reasoning: This rule establishes the pay rates for overtime hours worked on specific days within the schedule, a key aspect of time-based labor calculation.

name: 9/80 Schedule, Week 2 EDO Overtime
rule_text: Week 2 Time and one half (1 ½) for the first ten (10) hours worked on the earned Friday off...
summary: On the earned Friday off in Week 2 of a 9/80 schedule, the first 10 hours of work are paid at time and a half.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '9/80' AND week_number (Unsupported) == 2 AND day_of_week == 'FRI' AND daily_hours <= 10 -> PREMIUM(1.5)
reasoning: This rule sets a specific overtime rate for working on a scheduled day off, which is a rule for categorizing and paying for worked time.

name: 9/80 Schedule, General Double Time Overtime
rule_text: ...all other overtime is doubletime (2x).
summary: All overtime not otherwise specified is paid at double time. This applies to work on Saturdays and Sundays in both weeks, all overtime on Week 2 Mondays to Thursdays, and any hours worked beyond the first 10 on the earned Friday off in Week 2.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '9/80' AND ((week_number (Unsupported) == 1 AND day_of_week IN ['SAT', 'SUN']) OR (week_number (Unsupported) == 2 AND day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU'] AND daily_overtime_hours > 0) OR (week_number (Unsupported) == 2 AND day_of_week == 'FRI' AND daily_hours > 10) OR (week_number (Unsupported) == 2 AND day_of_week IN ['SAT', 'SUN'])) -> TRANSITION(DT)
reasoning: This is a catch-all rule that defines the pay rate for all remaining overtime scenarios, which is a fundamental part of worked time calculation.

name: Overtime Meal Entitlement
rule_text: It should be noted that those employees working more than ten (10) hours are entitled to an overtime meal and break at the ten (10) hour mark pursuant to the overtime meal articles in the agreement.
summary: Employees who work more than 10 hours in a single day are entitled to receive an overtime meal and a break at the 10-hour mark.
logical_representation: IF daily_hours > 10 -> PROVIDE(MEAL_AND_BREAK)
reasoning: This rule describes a condition based on hours worked that triggers a meal-related entitlement, which falls under the category of meal allowances.

name: Regular Workday, 5x8.6 Schedule
rule_text: Those employees working long-term maintenance at the Imperial Oil Strathcona site will work eight and six tenths (8 .6) hours at straight-time Monday to Friday.
summary: The standard work schedule for long-term maintenance employees is 8.6 hours per day at straight-time rates, from Monday to Friday.
logical_representation: IF day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU', 'FRI'] AND schedule_type == '5x8.6' -> MAX(8.6_HOURS_ST)
reasoning: This rule defines the standard working hours and days, which is a core concept of categorizing worked time.

name: Weekday Overtime, First Tier (1.5x)
rule_text: 1.4 hrs 1 ½
summary: On Monday through Friday, the first 1.4 hours of overtime worked after the regular 8.6 hours (i.e., hours from 8.6 up to 10) are paid at time and a half (1.5x).
logical_representation: IF day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU', 'FRI'] AND daily_hours > 8.6 AND daily_hours <= 10 -> TRANSITION(OT)
reasoning: This rule establishes the first overtime threshold and pay rate for a standard workday, a key function of time categorization.

name: Weekday Overtime, Second Tier (2x)
rule_text: DT After Ten (10)
summary: On Monday through Friday, all hours worked after 10 hours in a single day are paid at double time (2x).
logical_representation: IF day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU', 'FRI'] AND daily_hours > 10 -> TRANSITION(DT)
reasoning: This rule defines the second overtime threshold and pay rate for a standard workday, which is a core part of time categorization.

name: Saturday Work Pay Rate
rule_text: DT (x2)
summary: All hours worked on a Saturday are paid at double time (2x).
logical_representation: IF day_of_week == 'SAT' -> PREMIUM(2.0)
reasoning: This rule specifies the pay rate for a specific day of the week (Saturday), which is a rule for categorizing worked time.

name: Sunday Work Pay Rate
rule_text: DT (x2)
summary: All hours worked on a Sunday are paid at double time (2x).
logical_representation: IF day_of_week == 'SUN' -> PREMIUM(2.0)
reasoning: This rule specifies the pay rate for a specific day of the week (Sunday), which is a rule for categorizing worked time.

name: Overtime Meal Break Entitlement
rule_text: It  is  understood  that  those  required  to  work  more  than  ten  hours  (10)  on  this  shift  are  entitled  to  an overtime meal break at the ten-hour mark (10) pursuant to the overtime meal provisions in the collective agreement.
summary: An employee is entitled to an overtime meal break after working more than 10 hours in a single shift.
logical_representation: IF daily_hours > 10 -> PROVIDE(MEAL_BREAK)
reasoning: This rule explicitly defines the trigger (hours worked) for an overtime meal entitlement, which is the primary function of the LABOR_MEAL_ALLOWANCE topic.

name: Agreement Validity Period
rule_text: The following formula will be used for the determination of Long and Short Term Maintenance Base Rates and Benefits for the duration of the Agreement: January 1, 2025December 31, 2028.
summary: The wage and benefit formulas described are valid from January 1, 2025, to December 31, 2028.
logical_representation: APPLY_PAY_RULES('This Agreement') WHERE current_date >= '2025-01-01' AND current_date <= '2028-12-31'
reasoning: This rule establishes the effective date range for the wage and benefit formulas, which is a fundamental condition for calculating pay for time worked.

name: Apprentice Rate Calculation
rule_text: Apprentice rates are calculated at the percentages provided in the Local Construction Agreement applied to Maintenance Journeyperson Rate.
summary: Apprentice wages are determined by applying the percentage specified in the Local Construction Agreement to the Maintenance Journeyperson's rate.
logical_representation: IF employee_class == 'APPRENTICE' -> PAY(apprentice_rate = maintenance_journeyperson_rate * local_construction_agreement_percentage (llm))
reasoning: This rule specifies the calculation method for a specific class of employee's wages, which is a direct aspect of LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Compressed Work Week Rate Calculation
rule_text: Compressed Work Week Rates will be calculated pursuant to Article 17.000 of the Agreement.
summary: Pay rates for a compressed work week schedule must be calculated according to the rules in Article 17.000.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == 'COMPRESSED' -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('Article 17.000')
reasoning: The rule concerns how pay is calculated for a specific work schedule (CWW), which is a key part of managing and compensating labor worked time.

name: Employer Fund Contributions
rule_text: Employers will make appropriate contributions to the following funds for those participating trades which have the provision contained within their respective Industrial Construction Reference Agreement: - Building Trades of Alberta - Audiometric Testing - Construction Employee Family Assistance Program (CEFAP) - Case Managed Aftercare (CMAC) - Rapid Site Access Program (RSAP) - Workforce Development Trust Fund (WFDT)
summary: Employers must contribute to several specific funds (e.g., Building Trades of Alberta, CEFAP, RSAP) for trades whose Industrial Construction Reference Agreement includes these provisions.
logical_representation: IF position_classification requires_fund_contribution_per_reference_agreement (llm) == true -> PROVIDE(contributions_to_specified_funds)
reasoning: These contributions are a component of the total labor cost, typically calculated based on hours worked or wages paid. They are part of the overall compensation for labor, fitting under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Owner Sets Work Schedules
rule_text: Owner at its sole discretion will set all work schedules;
summary: The client (Owner) has the sole authority to determine all work schedules for the contractor.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT('Owner sets schedule_type')
reasoning: This rule directly pertains to the definition and control of work hours and schedules, which is the core of LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Statutory Holiday Pay
rule_text: Stat Holidays - follow terms of NMA or BM Agreement
summary: Pay for statutory holidays is governed by the terms of the NMA or Boilermaker Agreement.
logical_representation: IF is_stat_holiday == true -> APPLY_PAY_RULES(governing_agreement (llm))
reasoning: This rule concerns special pay conditions for a specific type of day (statutory holiday), which is a key part of worked time and compensation rules.

name: Governing Agreement for Payments
rule_text: All required payments per NMA applies to all positions including non-manuals, except for Boilermaker non-manuals which follow Boilermaker agreement
summary: All required payments are governed by the NMA for all staff, with the exception of Boilermaker non-manual staff, who are governed by the Boilermaker agreement.
logical_representation: IF position_classification == 'BOILERMAKER' AND is_non_manual_employee (llm) == true -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('Boilermaker Agreement') ELSE -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('NMA')
reasoning: This rule establishes which collective agreement dictates payment terms, a foundational rule for all labor billing and thus classified under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Meal Allowance
rule_text: Meal Break/allowance As per NMA, for all positions (manual and non-manual), except for Boilermaker manual and non-manuals, which follow Boilermaker Agreement
summary: Entitlement to meal breaks and allowances is determined by the NMA for all positions, except for Boilermakers (both manual and non-manual), whose entitlement is determined by the Boilermaker Agreement.
logical_representation: IF position_classification == 'BOILERMAKER' -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('Boilermaker Agreement', 'MEAL_ALLOWANCE') ELSE -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('NMA', 'MEAL_ALLOWANCE')
reasoning: This rule explicitly governs the conditions for receiving a meal allowance, which is the definition of the LABOR_MEAL_ALLOWANCE topic.

name: Living Out Allowance (LOA)
rule_text: LOA/day As per NMA, for all positions (manual and non-manual), except for Boilermaker manual and non-manuals, which follow Boilermaker Agreement, at a minimum
summary: Daily Living Out Allowance (LOA) is paid according to the NMA for all positions, except for Boilermakers (both manual and non-manual), who are paid according to the Boilermaker Agreement.
logical_representation: IF position_classification == 'BOILERMAKER' -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('Boilermaker Agreement', 'LOA') ELSE -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('NMA', 'LOA')
reasoning: This rule defines the entitlement and governing agreement for a daily living out allowance, which is synonymous with subsistence allowance, making LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE the correct topic.

name: Hiring Freedom for Commercial/Institutional Work
rule_text: For COMMERCIAL/INSTITUTIONAL work only the Employer has the freedom to select from the list of available unemployed members or transfer Employees from other work being performed for the same Employer, within the area jurisdiction of the Union(s).
summary: On Commercial or Institutional projects, the employer can freely select from the unemployed list or transfer existing employees from other company projects within the union's jurisdiction.
logical_representation: IF project_type IN ['COMMERCIAL', 'INSTITUTIONAL'] -> ALLOW(SELECTIVE_HIRE) OR ALLOW(TRANSFER)
reasoning: This rule defines an exception to the standard work assignment process based on project type. It governs who is eligible to be assigned work, placing it under the LABOR_WORKED_TIME topic.

name: Name Hire/Transfer Limit - Small Industrial Projects
rule_text: On INDUSTRIAL work, where a project requires twenty-five (25) or less Employees, the Employer may transfer or name hire any combination of fourteen (14) Employees to the job site, however, no more than six (6) Employees may be name hired.
summary: On Industrial projects with 25 or fewer employees, the employer can bring on a total of 14 employees through transfers or specific name requests, with a maximum of 6 of those being name hires.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND project_employee_count (llm) <= 25 -> CONSTRAINT(MAX_TRANSFER_OR_NAME_HIRE(14)) AND CONSTRAINT(MAX_NAME_HIRE(6))
reasoning: This rule sets quantitative limits on how labor can be sourced for a project based on its size and type. As it governs the assignment of workers, it falls under the LABOR_WORKED_TIME category.

name: Name Hire/Transfer Allowance - Large Industrial Projects
rule_text: On INDUSTRIAL work, where a project requires twenty-five (25) or more Employees, the Employer may utilize the option in (b) above and in addition may name hire or transfer one (1) additional Employee for every five (5) list hires
summary: On Industrial projects with 25 or more employees, the employer can use the initial 14 transfer/name hires, and then gets one additional transfer or name hire for every five employees hired from the union list.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND project_employee_count (llm) >= 25 -> ALLOW(TRANSFER_OR_NAME_HIRE_BASE(14)) AND ALLOW(ADDITIONAL_TRANSFER_OR_NAME_HIRE_RATIO(1/5_LIST_HIRES))
reasoning: This rule defines the ratio and allowance for sourcing labor outside the standard dispatch order for large projects. Since it controls the assignment of work, LABOR_WORKED_TIME is the appropriate topic.

name: Foreman Hiring Exception
rule_text: Not withstanding 7.01 (b), (c) and (d), Employees may be transferred, or name hired to be employed as Foremen or General Foremen subject to the following:
summary: The standard limits on transfers and name hires do not apply when hiring Foremen or General Foremen, provided certain conditions are met.
logical_representation: IF is_foreman == true -> OVERRIDE(HIRING_LIMITS)
reasoning: This rule provides a specific exception to the general labor assignment rules for a particular role (Foreman). As it governs how work is assigned, LABOR_WORKED_TIME is the correct classification.

name: Foreman ICCS Certification Requirement
rule_text: for the purposes of this Clause, Employees transferred, or name hired as Foremen or General Foremen shall be Industrial Construction Crew Supervisor (ICCS) certified effective May 1, 2017.
summary: Effective May 1, 2017, any employee transferred or name-hired as a Foreman or General Foreman must have an Industrial Construction Crew Supervisor (ICCS) certification.
logical_representation: IF is_foreman == true AND date >= '2017-05-01' -> REQUIRE(CERTIFICATION('ICCS'))
reasoning: This rule sets a qualification prerequisite for being assigned work as a Foreman. This condition for employment and work assignment places it within the LABOR_WORKED_TIME topic.

name: Foreman Minimum Pay Duration
rule_text: he/she will at no time be paid less than the Foreman's rate for which they qualify under Clause 25.02 (b) for a minimum of four (4) months from date of hire or transfer or until laid off if less than four (4) months.
summary: A newly hired or transferred Foreman must be paid at the Foreman's rate for at least four months, or until they are laid off if the job lasts less than four months.
logical_representation: IF is_foreman == true -> PAY_GUARANTEE(RATE('FOREMAN'), DURATION(MIN(4_MONTHS, UNTIL_LAYOFF)))
reasoning: This is a direct rule about pay rate and duration guarantees for a specific role. It defines compensation for time worked, making LABOR_WORKED_TIME the correct topic.

name: Hiring Non-Discrimination - Journeymen
rule_text: On hiring, there shall be no distinction between Alberta and UA classified Journeymen Steam Fitters/Pipe Fitters except as allowed for in Clause 25.02 (a).
summary: Employers cannot differentiate between Alberta-certified and UA-classified Journeymen Steam Fitter/Pipe Fitters during the hiring process, unless specified otherwise in Clause 25.02(a).
logical_representation: IF employee_class == 'JOURNEYMAN' AND position_classification == 'PIPEFITTER' -> CONSTRAINT(NO_DISTINCTION_ON_HIRING('ALBERTA_VS_UA_CERT'))
reasoning: This rule concerns equal eligibility for hiring and work assignment based on certifications. It is a condition of employment, which is foundational to worked time, so LABOR_WORKED_TIME is the appropriate category.

name: Apprentice to Journeyman Ratio
rule_text: The Employer will maintain a minimum ratio of 25% of the number of Journeymen employed on all projects that have more than 14 journeymen employed by that Employer.
summary: On projects with more than 14 journeymen, the employer must maintain a workforce where apprentices make up at least 25% of the number of journeymen.
logical_representation: IF count(JOURNEYMAN) > 14 -> REQUIRE(RATIO(APPRENTICE/JOURNEYMAN >= 0.25))
reasoning: This rule mandates a specific composition of the workforce, dictating the allocation of work opportunities between different classes of employees. This is a rule governing the assignment of labor, fitting under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Industrial H&W and ISIT Contribution Basis (Local 488)
rule_text: - 1) Calculate the Health and Welfare and "ISIT" contribution on hours earned
summary: For Industrial Work under Local 488, employer contributions for Health and Welfare (H&W) and ISIT funds are calculated based on total hours earned, not just hours worked.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND union_local (Unsupported) == '488' AND fund_type (llm) IN ['H&W', 'ISIT'] -> CALCULATE_CONTRIBUTION(basis=hours_basis (llm).EARNED)
reasoning: This rule specifies the calculation basis (hours earned) for monetary benefits, directly relating to how worked time is compensated.

name: Monthly Union Dues Calculation
rule_text: - 2) Monthly Union Dues = 3x base rate (maximum Journeyman Rate).
summary: Monthly union dues are calculated as three times the employee's base hourly rate, capped at the journeyman's base rate.
logical_representation: CALCULATE(monthly_union_dues) = 3 * MIN(base_rate (llm), journeyman_base_rate (llm))
reasoning: This rule defines a specific monetary deduction from employee wages, which is an integral part of their overall compensation structure.

name: Certified B Pressure Welder Premium
rule_text: - 5) B Pressure Welder with Alloy Certificates receive an additional $3.25 per hour worked.
summary: B Pressure Welders who hold Alloy Certificates are entitled to an additional premium of $3.25 for each hour they work.
logical_representation: IF position_classification == 'B_PRESSURE_WELDER' AND certification (llm) == 'ALLOY' -> PREMIUM($3.25) per hour_worked
reasoning: This rule establishes a wage premium based on a specific skill certification and hours worked, which is a direct modification of the labor rate.

name: Commercial/Institutional H&W Contribution Basis (Local 488)
rule_text: - 1) Calculate the Health and Welfare contribution on hours worked .
summary: For Commercial & Institutional Work under Local 488, employer contributions for the Health and Welfare (H&W) fund are calculated based on total hours worked.
logical_representation: IF project_type IN ['COMMERCIAL', 'INSTITUTIONAL'] AND union_local (Unsupported) == '488' AND fund_type (llm) == 'H&W' -> CALCULATE_CONTRIBUTION(basis=hours_basis (llm).WORKED)
reasoning: This rule dictates the calculation basis (hours worked) for a monetary benefit contribution, tying compensation directly to labor time.

name: Commercial/Institutional ISIT Contribution Basis (Local 488)
rule_text: - 2) Calculate "ISIT" contribution on hours earned .
summary: For Commercial & Institutional Work under Local 488, employer contributions for the ISIT fund are calculated based on total hours earned.
logical_representation: IF project_type IN ['COMMERCIAL', 'INSTITUTIONAL'] AND union_local (Unsupported) == '488' AND fund_type (llm) == 'ISIT' -> CALCULATE_CONTRIBUTION(basis=hours_basis (llm).EARNED)
reasoning: This rule determines how a specific monetary benefit is calculated based on hours, which is fundamental to labor compensation.

name: Instrument Mechanic H&W and ISIT Contribution Basis
rule_text: 1) Calculate the Health and Welfare and "ISIT" contribution on hours earned .
summary: For Instrument Mechanic/Welder & Plumber (488/496 Industrial), employer contributions for Health and Welfare (H&W) and ISIT funds are calculated based on total hours earned.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND position_classification == 'INSTRUMENT_MECHANIC' AND fund_type (llm) IN ['H&W', 'ISIT'] -> CALCULATE_CONTRIBUTION(basis=hours_basis (llm).EARNED)
reasoning: This rule specifies the basis (hours earned) for calculating benefit contributions, a key aspect of compensation for time worked.

name: Basis of Wage Increases
rule_text: (a) All wage and benefit increases shall be based on the journeyperson's total gross wage as listed under each of the wage schedules in article 8.01.
summary: All negotiated increases to wages and benefits are calculated based on the total gross wage of a journeyperson as specified in the agreement's wage schedules.
logical_representation: CALCULATE(wage_increase) BASED ON employee_class('JOURNEYMAN').total_gross_wage
reasoning: This rule defines the fundamental basis for calculating wage increases, directly impacting the monetary value of labor time.

name: Effective Date of Annual Wage Increases
rule_text: The wage schedules will include an increase on the first Sunday of May in each calendar year effective May 4 th , 2025.
summary: Wage rates are scheduled to increase annually on the first Sunday of May, starting from May 4, 2025.
logical_representation: IF date >= '2025-05-04' -> APPLY(annual_wage_increase) on first Sunday of May
reasoning: This rule sets the specific timing for wage rate changes, a critical component of labor compensation rules.

name: Apprentice Rate Proration
rule_text: (b) Increases will be applied to the Journeyman rate and apprentice rates will be prorated as per the established % of the Journeyman rate.
summary: When journeyman rates increase, apprentice rates will be adjusted proportionally based on their established percentage of the journeyman rate.
logical_representation: IF employee_class == 'APPRENTICE' -> CALCULATE(wage_rate) = journeyman_rate * apprentice_percentage
reasoning: This rule dictates how apprentice wages are calculated relative to journeyman wages, directly defining their pay for time worked.

name: Cap on Benefit Allocation from Future Increases
rule_text: (c) Effective May 4 th , 2025 the allocation to total benefits from future wage increases will not exceed 16.5% of the Journeyperson's Total Wage, rounded to the nearest 5 cents.
summary: Starting May 4, 2025, no more than 16.5% of any future wage increase for a Journeyperson can be allocated to benefits.
logical_representation: IF date >= '2025-05-04' -> CONSTRAINT(benefit_allocation_from_increase <= 0.165 * employee_class('JOURNEYMAN').total_wage)
reasoning: This rule limits how wage increases are distributed between direct pay and benefits, directly impacting the compensation structure.

name: Apprentice Advancement Criteria
rule_text:
8.03 In order for an apprentice to advance to a higher classification in the apprenticeship program, the following criteria must be attained:
- (a) Complete a minimum of 1500 hours of on-the-job training.
- (b) Attend school and pass the appropriate examination.
- (c) Complete those courses as directed by the Joint Educational Trust Fund Trustees in consultation with the Employer affected.
summary: To advance to the next level, an apprentice must complete at least 1500 hours of on-the-job training, pass their required school examinations, and finish any courses mandated by the Joint Educational Trust Fund.
logical_representation: IF employee_class == 'APPRENTICE' AND on_the_job_hours (llm) >= 1500 AND school_exam_passed (llm) == true AND required_courses_completed (llm) == true -> ELIGIBLE_FOR_ADVANCEMENT
reasoning: This rule sets the conditions for an apprentice to advance in classification, which directly corresponds to an increase in their wage rate for time worked.

name: Apprentice Wage Increase Timing
rule_text: (d) The apprentice's next period increase will become effective on the first pay period following the date the apprentice presents to his Employer the letter received from the Apprenticeship Board notifying them of successful completion of a schooling period unless the apprentice's anniversary date has not been reached. In that case the increase will become effective on the first pay period following the anniversary date.
summary: An apprentice's wage increase takes effect on the first pay period after they provide proof of successfully completing schooling, but not before their anniversary date. If schooling is completed before the anniversary date, the increase is effective on the first pay period after the anniversary date.
logical_representation: IF employee_class == 'APPRENTICE' AND proof_of_completion_provided (llm) == true AND anniversary_date_reached (llm) == true -> APPLY(wage_increase) on next pay_period
reasoning: This rule defines the precise timing for an apprentice's wage rate change, directly impacting their pay for time worked.

name: Industrial Pay Schedule
rule_text: 8.05 ( a) Pay day shall be once each week, and not more than five (5) days pay may be held back, unless other arrangements are made between the Employer and the Union.
summary: On industrial projects, employees must be paid weekly, and the employer cannot hold back more than five days of pay.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' -> PAY(weekly) AND MAX(pay_holdback=5_days)
reasoning: This rule establishes the frequency and terms of payment for labor performed, a fundamental condition of employment and compensation.

name: Commercial/Institutional Pay Schedule
rule_text: (d) Pay day shall be weekly or biweekly at the option of the Employer and not more than five (5) days pay may be held back, unless other arrangements are made between the Employer and the Union.
summary: On commercial or institutional projects, the employer can choose to pay employees either weekly or biweekly, and cannot hold back more than five days of pay.
logical_representation: IF project_type IN ['COMMERCIAL', 'INSTITUTIONAL'] -> PAY(weekly OR biweekly) AND MAX(pay_holdback=5_days)
reasoning: This rule defines the allowed frequencies for paying employees for their labor, a fundamental term of compensation.

name: Industrial Trust Fund Contribution Basis
rule_text: 8.11 (a) For INDUSTRIAL work, notwithstanding anything contained elsewhere in this Agreement, all contributions to the separate following trust funds shall be payable by the Employer on the Employee's total actual hours EARNED including overtime.
summary: For all industrial work, employer contributions to all trust funds must be calculated based on the employee's total hours earned, which includes overtime hours.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' -> CALCULATE_CONTRIBUTION(all_trust_funds, basis=hours_basis (llm).EARNED)
reasoning: This is a governing rule that defines the calculation basis (hours earned) for all benefit contributions on a specific type of project, fundamentally linking compensation to time.

name: Commercial/Institutional Trust Fund Contribution Basis
rule_text: (c) For COMMERCIAL/INSTITUTIONAL work, notwithstanding anything contained else-where in this Agreement, all contributions to the separate following Trust Funds shall be payable by the Employer on the Employees' total actual hours WORKED including overtime.
summary: For all commercial and institutional work, employer contributions to all trust funds must be calculated based on the employee's total hours worked, including overtime.
logical_representation: IF project_type IN ['COMMERCIAL', 'INSTITUTIONAL'] -> CALCULATE_CONTRIBUTION(all_trust_funds, basis=hours_basis (llm).WORKED)
reasoning: This is a governing rule that defines the calculation basis (hours worked) for all benefit contributions on specific project types, fundamentally linking compensation to time.

name: ISIT and MMDF Contribution Basis Override
rule_text: All contributions by the Employer(s) for the ISIT and MMDF plan(s) for both INDUSTRIAL and COMMERCIAL INSTITUTIONAL shall be contributed by the Employer based on the Employee's total actual hours EARNED including overtime.
summary: Regardless of whether the project is Industrial, Commercial, or Institutional, employer contributions for the ISIT and MMDF plans are always calculated based on the employee's total hours earned, including overtime.
logical_representation: IF fund_type (llm) IN ['ISIT', 'MMDF'] -> CALCULATE_CONTRIBUTION(basis=hours_basis (llm).EARNED) for all project_type
reasoning: This rule provides a specific override for certain funds, defining their calculation basis irrespective of other conditions. It's a key part of the overall compensation structure.

name: Welding Test, On Payroll
rule_text: In the case that any Journeyman, whose skill is welding, is required to take a customer requested welding test, the Employer agrees that such Journeyman will be in the employ of the Employer while taking such tests and be placed on the payroll and paid any applicable travel allowance.
summary: When a Journeyman welder is required to take a customer-requested welding test, they are considered to be employed and on the payroll during the test.
logical_representation: IF employee_class == 'JOURNEYMAN' AND position_classification == 'WELDER' AND activity_type (Unsupported) == 'CUSTOMER_WELDING_TEST' -> PAY(HOURS_WORKED)
reasoning: This rule defines that time spent on a specific activity (testing) is considered paid work time, which is a core function of the LABOR_WORKED_TIME topic.

name: Welding Test, Travel Allowance
rule_text: In the case that any Journeyman, whose skill is welding, is required to take a customer requested welding test, the Employer agrees that such Journeyman will be in the employ of the Employer while taking such tests and be placed on the payroll and paid any applicable travel allowance.
summary: When a Journeyman welder is required to take a customer-requested welding test, they must be paid any applicable travel allowance.
logical_representation: IF employee_class == 'JOURNEYMAN' AND position_classification == 'WELDER' AND activity_type (Unsupported) == 'CUSTOMER_WELDING_TEST' -> ALLOWANCE(TRAVEL)
reasoning: This rule specifies an entitlement to a monetary allowance for travel, which falls under the category of subsistence and work-related expense reimbursement.

name: Welding Test, Full Day Pay on Pass with No Work
rule_text: Provided that the Employee reports to test at the time scheduled by the Employer, they shall be paid one full day's pay if they pass the test, and the Employer has no work available for them on that day.
summary: A welder who reports for a test on time and passes is guaranteed a full day's pay if the employer has no work for them that day.
logical_representation: IF position_classification == 'WELDER' AND test_report_time (llm) == 'ON_TIME' AND test_result (Unsupported) == 'PASS' AND work_availability (llm) == 'NONE' -> PAY(FULL_DAY)
reasoning: This rule establishes a minimum payment guarantee (a full day's pay) based on specific conditions related to work activity, which is a aspect of LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Welding Test, Pay for Late Arrival
rule_text: if an Employee reports after the scheduled test time and passes the test they shall be paid from the time they started the test until the normal end of that shift.
summary: If a welder arrives late for a test but passes, they will be paid only from the time the test began until the end of the normal shift.
logical_representation: IF position_classification == 'WELDER' AND test_report_time (llm) == 'LATE' AND test_result (Unsupported) == 'PASS' -> PAY(FROM_TEST_START_TO_SHIFT_END)
reasoning: This rule details how to calculate paid hours under a specific circumstance (late arrival), which is a core concern of LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Welding Test, No Pay for Failed Test
