rule_text: A welder who fails the test shall not be paid for the time required to complete the failed test but will be paid any applicable travel allowance.
summary: A welder who fails a welding test will not be paid for the time spent taking that test.
logical_representation: IF position_classification == 'WELDER' AND test_result (Unsupported) == 'FAIL' -> FORFEIT(PAY_FOR_TEST_TIME)
reasoning: This rule specifies a condition under which time worked is not paid, directly relating to the calculation and categorization of worked time.

name: Welding Test, Travel Allowance on Failure
rule_text: A welder who fails the test shall not be paid for the time required to complete the failed test but will be paid any applicable travel allowance.
summary: A welder who fails a welding test is still entitled to receive any applicable travel allowance.
logical_representation: IF position_classification == 'WELDER' AND test_result (Unsupported) == 'FAIL' -> ALLOWANCE(TRAVEL)
reasoning: This rule confirms an entitlement to a monetary allowance for travel, even if the primary work activity (the test) was unsuccessful, fitting the LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE category.

name: Welding Test, Pay for Mixed Results if Hired
rule_text: In the event the worker is required to take multiple tests and passes some of the tests but fails others they will be paid as above if hired...
summary: If a welder takes multiple tests with mixed results (pass and fail) and is hired, their pay is determined by the standard rules for passing or failing tests.
logical_representation: IF position_classification == 'WELDER' AND test_result (Unsupported) == 'MIXED' AND employee_status (Unsupported) == 'HIRED' -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('13.02_PASS_FAIL')
reasoning: This rule directs how to calculate pay based on employment status and test outcomes, which falls under the rules for categorizing and paying for time worked.

name: Welding Test, Pay for Mixed Results if Not Hired
rule_text: In the event the worker is required to take multiple tests and passes some of the tests but fails others they ... will be paid for the time taken on successful tests if not hired.
summary: If a welder takes multiple tests with mixed results and is not hired, they will only be paid for the time spent on the tests they passed.
logical_representation: IF position_classification == 'WELDER' AND test_result (Unsupported) == 'MIXED' AND employee_status (Unsupported) != 'HIRED' -> PAY(TIME_ON_SUCCESSFUL_TESTS)
reasoning: This rule specifies exactly which hours are compensable based on test outcomes and hiring status, a key function of LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Welding Test, Pay for Lost Day Due to Delays
rule_text: Welders successfully completing such tests shall receive a regular day's pay at straight time rates for any working day lost, due to transportation delays, or when test pieces must be sent to an outside agency for assessment, except when transportation delays are beyond the control of the Employer.
summary: A welder who passes a test will receive a full day's pay at straight time for any workday lost due to transportation delays (if within the employer's control) or because test results are pending from an external agency.
logical_representation: IF position_classification == 'WELDER' AND test_result (Unsupported) == 'PASS' AND ((reason_for_delay (llm) == 'TRANSPORTATION' AND delay_control (llm) == 'EMPLOYER') OR reason_for_delay (llm) == 'EXTERNAL_ASSESSMENT') -> PAY(FULL_DAY_ST)
reasoning: This rule provides for 'waiting time' pay, which is a form of guaranteed payment for non-productive time due to specific circumstances, categorizing it under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Welding Test, Forfeiture for Failure to Report
rule_text: Welders, upon successfully completing such tests, who fail to report for work, or fail to commence work when directed, will not be eligible for daily subsistence, travel allowance, transportation, accommodation, waiting, and/or testing time pay.
summary: A welder who passes a test but then fails to report for or start work as directed forfeits their eligibility for subsistence, travel, transportation, accommodation, and pay for waiting or testing time.
logical_representation: IF position_classification == 'WELDER' AND test_result (Unsupported) == 'PASS' AND (work_start_status (Unsupported) == 'FAIL_TO_REPORT' OR work_start_status (Unsupported) == 'FAIL_TO_COMMENCE') -> FORFEIT(SUBSISTENCE, TRAVEL_ALLOWANCE, TRANSPORTATION, ACCOMMODATION, WAITING_TIME_PAY, TESTING_TIME_PAY)
reasoning: This rule primarily details the forfeiture of various allowances (subsistence, travel, accommodation), making LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE the primary topic, though it also includes forfeiture of paid time.

name: Welder Testing Fee Entitlement
rule_text: A welder (Journeyman or Apprentice) who is required by the Employer or the Employer's client to perform on any Gas Tungsten Arc Welding (GTAW) test or Gas Metal Arc Welding (GMAW) test or Flux-Core Arc Welding (FCAW) test for pressure welding will be paid a testing fee of one hundred and seventy-five ($175.00) dollars effective May 1, 2013 providing they meet the following criteria:
summary: Effective May 1, 2013, a welder (Journeyman or Apprentice) required to perform a GTAW, GMAW, or FCAW pressure welding test will be paid a $175.00 fee, provided certain criteria are met.
logical_representation: IF (position_classification == 'WELDER' AND (employee_class == 'JOURNEYMAN' OR employee_class == 'APPRENTICE')) AND test_type (llm) IN ['GTAW', 'GMAW', 'FCAW_PRESSURE'] AND validity_start_date >= '2013-05-01' AND CONDITIONS_MET(13.06a,b,c) -> ALLOWANCE(175.00_TESTING_FEE)
reasoning: This rule establishes a special payment (a fee) for a specific work-related activity. While not an hourly wage, it is compensation tied to work performed, making LABOR_WORKED_TIME the most appropriate category.

name: Testing Fee Condition - Pass Test
rule_text: (a) The welder must successfully pass the relevant test.
summary: To be eligible for the $175 welder incentive test fee, the welder must successfully pass the test.
logical_representation: CONDITION FOR ALLOWANCE(175.00_TESTING_FEE): test_result (Unsupported) == 'PASS'
reasoning: This is a condition for a payment related to a work activity, and therefore falls under the umbrella of rules governing pay for worked time.

name: Testing Fee Condition - Employment Duration
rule_text: (b) The welder remains on the project a minimum of thirty (30) days or until lay off, whichever occurs first
summary: To be eligible for the $175 welder incentive test fee, the welder must stay on the project for at least 30 days, unless they are laid off sooner.
logical_representation: CONDITION FOR ALLOWANCE(175.00_TESTING_FEE): project_days_employed (llm) >= 30 OR employee_status (Unsupported) == 'LAID_OFF'
reasoning: This rule establishes a condition based on employment duration for a specific payment, connecting it to the overall framework of compensation for labor.

name: Testing Fee Condition - Procedure Utilization
rule_text: (c) The welder cannot refuse to utilize the tested procedure while employed on the project.
summary: To be eligible for the $175 welder incentive test fee, the welder must not refuse to use the tested procedure while working on the project.
logical_representation: CONDITION FOR ALLOWANCE(175.00_TESTING_FEE): procedure_refusal (llm) == false
reasoning: This rule links a behavioral requirement during work to eligibility for a payment, making it a condition related to labor compensation.

name: Testing Fee Payment Timing
rule_text: Providing these criteria are met, the welder incentive test fee will be paid after the thirty days of employment or upon lay off, whichever occurs first.
summary: If all eligibility criteria are met, the $175 welder incentive test fee will be paid out after 30 days of employment or at the time of layoff, whichever comes first.
logical_representation: IF CONDITIONS_MET(13.06a,b,c) -> PAY(175.00_TESTING_FEE) AFTER(MIN(30_days, layoff_date))
reasoning: This rule defines the timing of a specific payment for work performed, which is an aspect of administering pay for labor.

name: Alloy Welder Premium on Dispatch
rule_text: Welders with a valid alloy welding certificate will be paid an additional premium of $3.25 per hour worked if certification was a requirement for dispatch.
summary: Welders who hold a valid alloy welding certificate receive a premium of $3.25 per hour if that certification was a specific requirement for their dispatch to the job.
logical_representation: IF position_classification == 'WELDER' AND welding_certification_type (llm) == 'ALLOY' AND dispatch_requirement (llm) == 'ALLOY_CERTIFICATION' -> PREMIUM(3.25)
reasoning: This rule specifies an hourly wage premium based on qualifications and job requirements, which is a direct modification of the pay rate for time worked.

name: Alloy Welder Re-classification and Premium
rule_text: If a welder on site who was not dispatched as an alloy welder, but has the certification, or is requested to be certified by the employer and is requested to perform alloy welding, the worker will be re-classified as an alloy welder and paid the alloy welder premium for all hours worked during the applicable work cycle.
summary: A welder on site who was not dispatched as an alloy welder but is asked to perform alloy welding (and either has the certification or is asked to get it) will be re-classified as an alloy welder and receive the alloy premium for all hours in that work cycle.
logical_representation: IF position_classification == 'WELDER' AND dispatch_requirement (llm) != 'ALLOY_CERTIFICATION' AND (welding_certification_type (llm) == 'ALLOY' OR employer_requests_certification (llm) == true) AND assigned_work_type (llm) == 'ALLOY_WELDING' -> RECLASSIFY('ALLOY_WELDER') AND PREMIUM(3.25) FOR all_hours IN work_cycle (llm)
reasoning: This rule outlines the conditions for re-classification and the application of a wage premium for a defined period (work cycle), directly affecting how time is paid.

name: Permanent Alloy Premium on 3rd Re-classification
rule_text: The worker may only be reclassified to a maximum of 2 times in a calendar year, if the worker is reclassified a 3rd time within the calendar year the worker is entitled to the premium for all hours worked from the date of the employee being reclassified a 3rd time, until the worker is laid off or terminated.
summary: If a worker is re-classified to an alloy welder for a third time in a calendar year, they become entitled to the alloy premium for all hours worked from that point until they are laid off or terminated.
logical_representation: IF position_classification == 'WELDER' AND reclassification_count_yearly (llm) >= 3 -> PREMIUM(3.25) FOR all_hours FROM third_reclassification_date UNTIL (employee_status (Unsupported) == 'LAID_OFF' OR employee_status (Unsupported) == 'TERMINATED')
reasoning: This rule establishes a long-term wage premium based on the frequency of a work assignment, fundamentally altering the worker's rate of pay for their worked hours.

name: Apprentice Pay Rate with Provisional 'C' Ticket
rule_text: When an apprentice in the employ of an employer acquires a Provisional 'C' Welders ticket that allows them to perform pressure welds for that employer that apprentice will be paid at the 'Journeyman Welder without CWB' rate while engaged in that work for their employer.
summary: An apprentice who obtains a Provisional 'C' Welder ticket will be paid at the 'Journeyman Welder without CWB' rate when performing pressure welds for their employer.
logical_representation: IF employee_class == 'APPRENTICE' AND welding_certification_type (llm) == 'PROVISIONAL_C' AND assigned_work_type (llm) == 'PRESSURE_WELDING' -> PAY_RATE('JOURNEYMAN_WELDER_WITHOUT_CWB')
reasoning: This rule defines the specific rate of pay for an employee based on their certification and the type of work performed, which is a core component of LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Out-of-Province Journeyman Pay Rate with Provisional 'C' Ticket
rule_text: A journeyman pressure welder from another jurisdiction outside of Alberta who is working under a Provisional 'C' Welders ticket will be paid at the UA Journeyman Steamfitter and B Pressure Welder rate.
summary: A journeyman pressure welder from outside Alberta working with a Provisional 'C' Welder ticket must be paid at the UA Journeyman Steamfitter and B Pressure Welder rate.
logical_representation: IF employee_class == 'JOURNEYMAN' AND position_classification == 'PRESSURE_WELDER' AND jurisdiction (Unsupported) != 'ALBERTA' AND welding_certification_type (llm) == 'PROVISIONAL_C' -> PAY_RATE('UA_JOURNEYMAN_STEAMFITTER_AND_B_PRESSURE_WELDER')
reasoning: This rule specifies the exact pay rate for a worker based on their classification, origin, and certification, directly governing how their worked time is compensated.

name: Recognized Holiday Pay Rate
rule_text: All work performed on the following recognized holidays, and any general holiday declared by the level of government with jurisdiction, either the Federal or Provincial, shall be paid for at the rate of double time, plus any applicable shift differential, as follows:
summary: Work performed on a recognized holiday, or any holiday declared by the federal or provincial government, is paid at double time (2x the regular rate), in addition to any applicable shift differential.
logical_representation: IF is_stat_holiday == true -> PREMIUM(2.0) + SHIFT_DIFFERENTIAL
reasoning: This rule defines a specific pay rate (double time) for hours worked on designated holidays, which is a core concept of categorizing and calculating pay for labor time.

name: List of Recognized Holidays
rule_text:
| New Years Day (Jan 1)   | Labour Day (September)             |
|-------------------------|------------------------------------|
| Family Day (February)   | Nat. Day for Truth &Rec. (Sept 30) |
| Good Friday (April)     | Thanksgiving Day (October)         |
| Victoria Day (Monday)   | Remembrance Day (Nov 11)           |
| Canada Day (July1)      | Christmas Day (Dec 25)             |
| Heritage Day (August)   | Boxing Day (Dec 26)                |
summary: The agreement recognizes twelve specific holidays: New Year's Day, Family Day, Good Friday, Victoria Day, Canada Day, Heritage Day, Labour Day, National Day for Truth & Reconciliation, Thanksgiving Day, Remembrance Day, Christmas Day, and Boxing Day.
logical_representation: DEFINE(is_stat_holiday) FOR DATES [New Years Day, Family Day, Good Friday, Victoria Day, Canada Day, Heritage Day, Labour Day, Nat. Day for Truth & Rec., Thanksgiving Day, Remembrance Day, Christmas Day, Boxing Day]
reasoning: This rule provides the specific list of days that are classified as statutory holidays, which is essential for applying other pay and work rules related to labor time.

name: Holiday Observance Date
rule_text: Each of the general holidays listed in clause 14.01 shall be observed on the calendar date on which it occurs, premiums will apply for hours worked
summary: Recognized holidays are observed on their actual calendar date, and premium pay applies for any hours worked on that specific date.
logical_representation: IF is_stat_holiday == true -> APPLY_ON(calendar_date (llm))
reasoning: This rule specifies the timing for the application of holiday premium pay, which is a condition for how labor time is categorized and compensated.

name: Labour Day Work Restriction
rule_text: No work shall be performed on Labour Day, except for the preservation of life or imminent danger to property.
summary: Work is prohibited on Labour Day unless it is an emergency situation to protect life or prevent imminent danger to property.
logical_representation: IF is_stat_holiday == true AND holiday_name (llm) == 'LABOUR_DAY' AND work_reason (llm) NOT IN ['PRESERVATION_OF_LIFE', 'IMMINENT_DANGER_TO_PROPERTY'] -> CONSTRAINT(WORK_PROHIBITED)
reasoning: This rule places a constraint on when work can be performed, which directly relates to the management and scheduling of labor time.

name: Holiday Pay In-Lieu
rule_text: In lieu of pay for the above recognized holidays the Employer shall pay an additional 4% to the Employee's total hourly earnings each week, including overtime hours and premium time hours.
summary: Instead of receiving pay for recognized holidays not worked, employees receive an additional 4% of their total weekly hourly earnings. This calculation includes straight time, overtime, and premium time hours.
logical_representation: CALCULATE(holiday_pay_in_lieu (llm)) -> (total_weekly_earnings (llm) * 0.04)
reasoning: This rule defines a specific calculation for holiday pay entitlement based on total earnings, which is a form of compensation for labor time.

name: Vacation/Holiday Pay Payout Options (Calgary 496)
summary: For commercial or institutional work within the Calgary 496 jurisdiction, the employer has several options for when to pay out vacation and statutory holiday pay: with each paycheck, when vacation is taken, on the last payday of the year, or upon termination.
logical_representation: IF jurisdiction (Unsupported) == 'CALGARY_496' AND project_type IN ['COMMERCIAL', 'INSTITUTIONAL'] -> OPTION(PAY(vhp_shp (llm)), ['EACH_PAYCHECK', 'ON_VACATION', 'LAST_PAYDAY_OF_YEAR', 'ON_TERMINATION'])
reasoning: This rule outlines conditional options for the timing of payment for earned benefits (vacation and holiday pay), which is an administrative aspect of compensating labor time.

name: Extended Overtime Coffee Breaks
rule_text: If extended overtime is required, additional coffee breaks shall be permitted during such overtime after each two (2) hours following each overtime meal break.
summary: During extended overtime, employees are entitled to an additional coffee break for every two hours worked after an overtime meal break.
logical_representation: IF event (Unsupported) == 'conclusion_of_overtime_meal_break' AND daily_overtime_hours % 2 == 0 -> PROVIDE(break, type='COFFEE', is_paid=true)
reasoning: This rule creates an entitlement to additional paid break time triggered by the duration of overtime work, directly impacting the structure of paid time during overtime.

name: Industrial Compressed Work Week Breaks
rule_text: However, for INDUSTRIAL WORK ONLY and on a compressed work week scheduled pursuant to Article 17.00, Employees shall be permitted a break of fifteen (15) minutes in the first half and fifteen (15) minutes in the second half of such shifts.
summary: For industrial projects on a compressed work week schedule, employees receive two 15-minute breaks instead of the standard 10-minute breaks.
logical_representation: IF project_type (llm) == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND schedule_type LIKE '%compressed%' -> PROVIDE(break, type='COFFEE', duration=15_minutes, quantity=2, is_paid=true)
reasoning: This rule modifies the standard paid break duration based on specific work conditions (project type and schedule), which is a key factor in calculating paid hours for a shift.

name: 10-Hour Shift Paid Breaks Option
rule_text: When ten (10) hour shifts are worked, in lieu of the work breaks and lunch breaks provided herein, the Employer shall have the option of scheduling two breaks of one half (½) hour each, paid at the applicable rate, approximately equally spaced in the ten (10) hour shift.
summary: On 10-hour shifts, the employer has the option to provide two paid 30-minute breaks instead of the standard unpaid lunch and paid coffee breaks.
logical_representation: IF daily_hours == 10 -> OPTION(PROVIDE(break, duration=0.5_hours, quantity=2, is_paid=true)) IN_LIEU_OF(standard_breaks_and_lunch)
reasoning: This rule provides an alternative structure for breaks and pay on a specific shift length, converting an unpaid period into paid time, which fundamentally alters the calculation of total paid hours.

name: Missed Break Penalty (10-Hour Shift Option)
rule_text: In the event an employee is not able to take a break, the employee shall be paid at applicable overtime rates for the missed break.
summary: If an employee working under the 10-hour shift paid break option is unable to take their break, they must be paid for the missed break time at overtime rates.
logical_representation: IF daily_hours == 10 AND break_taken_status (llm) == 'MISSED' -> PAY(missed_break_duration, rate='OT')
reasoning: This rule specifies a premium payment for a missed entitlement, which is a direct calculation impacting labor cost and falls under the categorization of worked time.

name: 10-Hour Paid Break Option Inapplicable
rule_text: This option shall not be applicable to compressed work weeks for which workdays are regularly scheduled in excess of ten (10) hours.
summary: The option to have two paid 30-minute breaks is not available on compressed work week schedules where shifts are regularly longer than 10 hours.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type LIKE '%compressed%' AND daily_hours > 10 -> FORBID(OPTION(paid_breaks_in_lieu_of_lunch))
reasoning: This rule acts as a constraint on the application of a specific pay and break schedule, which is essential for determining the correct time and pay structure.

name: Normal Workday Hours
rule_text: The maximum of eight (8) hours shall constitute a normal day's work beginning at 8:00 AM and ending by 5:00 PM
summary: A normal workday consists of a maximum of eight hours.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT(MAX_NORMAL_DAILY_HOURS == 8)
reasoning: This rule defines the standard number of hours in a regular workday, which is foundational for calculating overtime.

name: Normal Work Week
rule_text: The maximum normal work week shall be forty (40) hours beginning Monday at 8:00 AM and ending Friday at 5:00 PM.
summary: A normal work week is a maximum of 40 hours, running from Monday to Friday.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT(MAX_NORMAL_WEEKLY_HOURS == 40) AND CONSTRAINT(NORMAL_WORK_WEEK_DAYS == ['MON','TUE','WED','THU','FRI'])
reasoning: This rule defines the standard hours and days for a work week, which is essential for determining when weekly overtime applies.

name: No Guarantee of Work Hours
rule_text: The above schedule is intended to represent a  normal workday or work week and is not to be construed as a guarantee of hours of work per day or per week or with respect to days in a week.
summary: The defined normal work schedule does not guarantee a minimum number of work hours or days.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT(GUARANTEE_OF_HOURS == FALSE)
reasoning: This rule clarifies that the schedule definitions are not minimum pay guarantees, which is a key aspect of labor time and compensation.

name: General Overtime Trigger
rule_text: Forty (40) hours shall constitute a work week, Monday through Friday. All other time worked shall be considered overtime and shall be paid for at the applicable overtime rate of pay.
summary: A work week is 40 hours, Monday to Friday. Any hours worked outside of this are considered overtime.
logical_representation: IF weekly_hours > 40 OR day_of_week IN ['SAT', 'SUN'] -> TRANSITION(OT)
reasoning: This rule provides the primary definition for what constitutes overtime based on weekly hours and days of the week.

name: First Tier Daily Overtime (Mon-Fri)
rule_text: The first two (2) hours of overtime per day, Monday through Friday inclusive, shall be paid at one and one half (1½) times the applicable rate of pay.
summary: From Monday to Friday, the first two hours of overtime per day are paid at 1.5 times the regular rate.
logical_representation: IF day_of_week IN ['MON','TUE','WED','THU','FRI'] AND daily_hours > 8 AND daily_overtime_hours <= 2 -> PREMIUM(1.5)
reasoning: This rule defines a specific pay rate for the initial block of daily overtime hours, which is a core function of categorizing worked time.

name: Second Tier Daily Overtime (Mon-Fri)
rule_text: All other overtime hours, Monday through Friday inclusive, shall be paid at two (2) times the applicable rate of pay.
summary: From Monday to Friday, any overtime hours worked beyond the first two are paid at double the regular rate.
logical_representation: IF day_of_week IN ['MON','TUE','WED','THU','FRI'] AND daily_hours > 10 AND daily_overtime_hours > 2 -> PREMIUM(2.0)
reasoning: This rule establishes the pay rate for subsequent overtime hours after an initial threshold, further defining the compensation for worked time.

name: Weekend and Holiday Overtime
rule_text: All hours worked on Saturday, Sunday and Statutory Holidays shall be paid at two (2) times the applicable rate of pay.
summary: All hours worked on Saturdays, Sundays, and Statutory Holidays are paid at double the regular rate.
logical_representation: IF day_of_week IN ['SAT', 'SUN'] OR is_stat_holiday == TRUE -> PREMIUM(2.0)
reasoning: This rule sets a specific premium rate for work performed on special days (weekends and holidays), which is a key part of classifying worked time.

name: Overtime for Commercial/Institutional Projects
rule_text: All hours worked in excess of eight (8) hours per day or forty (40) hours per week will be considered to be overtime hours and will be paid at the rate of one and one-half times the applicable rate of pay except for work on Sundays and Statutory Holidays which will be paid at double time.
summary: On Commercial or Institutional projects, overtime is paid at 1.5x for hours over 8 daily or 40 weekly. However, all work on Sundays and Statutory Holidays is paid at 2.0x.
logical_representation: IF project_type IN ['COMMERCIAL', 'INSTITUTIONAL'] AND (day_of_week == 'SUN' OR is_stat_holiday == TRUE) -> PREMIUM(2.0) ELSE IF project_type IN ['COMMERCIAL', 'INSTITUTIONAL'] AND (daily_hours > 8 OR weekly_hours > 40) -> PREMIUM(1.5)
reasoning: This rule provides a specific set of overtime conditions that apply only to certain project types, overriding the general overtime rules.

name: Overtime Calculation Timing
rule_text: For  the  purposes  of  calculating  overtime  hours,  overtime  shall  normally  be  paid  upon  the completion  of  the  regular  days  shift.
summary: Overtime hours are typically calculated and compensated after the regular day's shift is completed.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT(OVERTIME_CALCULATION_TIMING == 'POST_SHIFT')
reasoning: This rule specifies the procedural timing for calculating overtime, which is an integral part of processing worked time.

name: Compressed Work Week, Normal Day Definition
rule_text: The maximum of ten (10) hours shall constitute a normal day's work beginning at 7:00 AM and ending by 6:00 PM (except when one-half (½) hour lunch is taken in which case the normal day will end at 5:30 PM).
summary: Under a compressed work week, a normal day is a maximum of 10 hours, typically starting at 7:00 AM and ending by 6:00 PM.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10' -> DEFINE(NORMAL_DAY_MAX(10_hours))
reasoning: This rule defines the standard hours for a workday within a specific schedule, which is a core component of categorizing worked time.

name: Compressed Work Week, Normal Week Definition
rule_text: The maximum normal work week shall be forty (40) hours beginning Monday at 7:00 AM and ending Thursday at 6:00 PM.
summary: Under a compressed work week, the normal work week is a maximum of 40 hours, running from Monday morning to Thursday evening.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10_mon-thu' -> DEFINE(NORMAL_WEEK_MAX(40_hours))
reasoning: This rule establishes the standard weekly hours and days for a compressed schedule, which is fundamental to calculating straight time and overtime.

name: No Guarantee of Hours
rule_text: The above schedule is intended to represent a normal workday or work week and is not to be construed as a guarantee of hours of work per day or per week or with respect to days in a week.
summary: The defined work schedules do not guarantee a specific number of work hours or days to an employee.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT(SCHEDULE_DOES_NOT_GUARANTEE_HOURS)
reasoning: This rule sets a condition on the application of work schedules, clarifying that they are not a guarantee of payment, which directly relates to how worked time is administered.

name: 4x10 Schedule Implementation
rule_text: The Employer may schedule the regular work week in four (4) consecutive ten (10) hour days, at straight time rates, provided only that the four (4) ten (10) hour days are scheduled during the Monday through Thursday period unless varied by mutual consent between the Employer and the Union.
summary: An employer can implement a 4x10 schedule from Monday to Thursday at straight time rates. Any variation to these days requires mutual consent.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10_mon-thu' -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('4x10_mon-thu')
reasoning: This rule explicitly defines a valid work schedule and its corresponding pay rate (straight time), which is a primary function of categorizing worked time.

name: 4x10 Schedule, Friday Work
rule_text: On a four (4) ten (10) schedule, when Friday is worked, the first ten hours shall be paid at one and oneha1f (1½x) times the applicable rate of pay.
summary: On a standard 4x10 (Mon-Thu) schedule, the first 10 hours worked on a Friday are paid at time and a half.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10_mon-thu' AND day_of_week == 'FRI' AND daily_hours <= 10 -> PREMIUM(1.5)
reasoning: This rule specifies an overtime condition for a specific day of the week under a particular schedule, which is a classic worked time rule.

name: 10 on 4 off Schedule Definition
rule_text: A ten (10) on and four (4) off schedule may also be established as a compressed work week schedule and when utilized, the straight time days will be Tuesday through Friday in one week followed by Monday through Thursday in the subsequent week.
summary: A '10 on, 4 off' compressed work week schedule is permitted. Straight time days are Tuesday-Friday in the first week and Monday-Thursday in the second week.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '10_on_4_off' -> DEFINE(STRAIGHT_TIME_DAYS)
reasoning: This rule defines the structure of an alternative work schedule, including which days are considered straight time. This is fundamental to categorizing worked time.

name: 10 on 4 off Schedule, Overtime on Scheduled Days Off (Fri/Mon)
rule_text: Should an employee work on the scheduled days off, the Friday and Monday will be paid at time and one half (1½x)...
summary: On a '10 on, 4 off' schedule, if an employee works on their scheduled Friday or Monday off, they are paid at time and a half.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '10_on_4_off' AND is_scheduled_day_off (llm) == true AND (day_of_week == 'FRI' OR day_of_week == 'MON') -> PREMIUM(1.5)
reasoning: This rule establishes a specific overtime rate for working on designated days off within a defined schedule, which is a core worked time calculation.

name: 10 on 4 off Schedule, Overtime on Scheduled Days Off (Sat/Sun)
rule_text: ...and the Saturday and Sunday will be paid at double time (2x).
summary: On a '10 on, 4 off' schedule, if an employee works on their scheduled Saturday or Sunday off, they are paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '10_on_4_off' AND is_scheduled_day_off (llm) == true AND (day_of_week == 'SAT' OR day_of_week == 'SUN') -> PREMIUM(2.0)
reasoning: This rule establishes a specific double time rate for working on designated weekend days off within a defined schedule, which is a core worked time calculation.

name: 10 on 4 off, Optional Weekend Overtime
rule_text: When a ten (10) on and four (4) off schedule is utilized, overtime on the Saturday and Sunday that fall in the middle of the schedule will be optional.
summary: For employees on a '10 on, 4 off' schedule, working overtime on the Saturday and Sunday that fall between the work weeks is optional.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '10_on_4_off' AND (day_of_week == 'SAT' OR day_of_week == 'SUN') -> CONSTRAINT(OVERTIME_IS_OPTIONAL)
reasoning: This rule defines the nature of scheduled overtime (optional vs. mandatory), which is an aspect of managing and categorizing worked time.

name: Notice to Decline Optional Overtime
rule_text: Employees will be required to give seventy-two (72) hours' notice of their intention not to work such overtime.
summary: Employees must provide 72 hours' notice if they choose not to work the optional weekend overtime on a '10 on, 4 off' schedule.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '10_on_4_off' AND employee_declines_optional_overtime (llm) == true -> REQUIRE(notice_period_hours (llm) >= 72)
reasoning: This rule sets a procedural requirement related to working scheduled overtime, which is part of administering worked time.

name: Daily Overtime on Compressed Schedule (General)
rule_text: Where these options are worked, all hours in excess of ten (10) hours per day Monday through Thursday, shall be paid for at two (2x) times the applicable rate of pay.
summary: On a compressed work week, any hours worked beyond 10 per day from Monday to Thursday are paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type IN ['4x10_mon-thu', '10_on_4_off'] AND day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU'] AND daily_hours > 10 -> PREMIUM(2.0)
reasoning: This rule defines the daily overtime threshold and the corresponding pay rate for compressed schedules, which is a direct calculation of worked time.

name: Overtime on Commercial/Institutional Projects
rule_text: Notwithstanding the foregoing, all overtime hours on Commercial/Institutional projects shall be paid for at the rate of time and one-half...
summary: As an exception, all overtime hours on Commercial or Institutional projects are paid at time and a half.
logical_representation: IF project_type IN ['COMMERCIAL', 'INSTITUTIONAL'] -> PAY(ALL_OT_HOURS, 1.5)
reasoning: This rule provides an override for overtime calculations based on the type of project, modifying the standard worked time rules.

name: Overtime in Local 488 Jurisdiction
rule_text: ...except for work in Local 488's jurisdiction where work on Sundays and Statutory Holidays shall be paid at double time.
summary: A further exception for Commercial/Institutional projects: work performed on Sundays or Statutory Holidays within Local 488's jurisdiction is paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF project_type IN ['COMMERCIAL', 'INSTITUTIONAL'] AND union_local (Unsupported) == '488' AND (day_of_week == 'SUN' OR is_stat_holiday == true) -> PREMIUM(2.0)
reasoning: This rule specifies a special overtime rate based on location, day of the week, and holiday status, making it a detailed worked time rule.

name: Owner-Requested Schedules
rule_text: If a work schedule that is not currently addressed in the collective agreement is requested by the owner, the Parties' agreement to implement the work schedule as per the Owner's request which will not be unreasonably withheld.
summary: If a project owner requests a work schedule not covered in the agreement, the union and employer will not unreasonably withhold their agreement to implement it.
logical_representation: IF owner_requests_non_standard_schedule (llm) == true -> CONSTRAINT(AGREEMENT_NOT_UNREASONABLY_WITHHELD)
reasoning: This rule provides a mechanism for adopting new work schedules, directly impacting how work hours are structured and categorized.

name: Overtime Qualification with Preauthorized Absence
rule_text: A worker who is preauthorized to take personal time off pursuant to the above procedure, will qualify for overtime premiums for any work performed either preceding or following the normal scheduled hours of work on the day they take their personal absence regardless of whether or not they have worked the full eight or ten hours as scheduled for that shift.
summary: If an employee has a preauthorized absence, they are still eligible for daily overtime pay for hours worked before or after their normal shift time on that day, even though they did not complete a full day.
logical_representation: IF is_absence_preauthorized (Unsupported) == true -> PAY(hours_outside_normal_shift (llm), OT_RATE)
reasoning: This rule creates an exception to the standard daily overtime threshold based on an authorized absence, making it a key rule for calculating worked time.

name: Weekly Overtime Qualification with Preauthorized Absence (Compressed)
rule_text: In the case of a worker on a compressed work week schedule they would also be paid normal overtime premiums for any hours worked on the compressed work weekday off. It is also understood that, provided such absences conform to these conditions, the absence will not disqualify the worker from working overtime scheduled for that week.
summary: On a compressed schedule, a preauthorized absence does not disqualify a worker from receiving overtime pay for working on their scheduled day off (e.g., Friday) or from working other scheduled overtime that week.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type IN ['4x10_mon-thu', '10_on_4_off'] AND is_absence_preauthorized (Unsupported) == true -> CONSTRAINT(ELIGIBLE_FOR_WEEKLY_OT)
reasoning: This rule clarifies that an authorized absence does not negate eligibility for weekly overtime, which is a critical detail in the calculation of total weekly pay.

name: Standard Daily Overtime Threshold
rule_text: Overtime premiums as specified in this Collective Agreement will be paid for all hours worked in excess of eight hours in a day.
summary: For standard (non-compressed) schedules, overtime is paid for all hours worked beyond eight in a single day.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '5x8' AND daily_hours > 8 -> TRANSITION(OT)
reasoning: This rule defines the basic daily overtime threshold, which is the most fundamental type of worked time rule.

name: Compressed Work Week Overtime Threshold
rule_text: In the case of a compressed work week, overtime premiums will be paid for hours worked in excess of ten in a day or forty in a week.
summary: For a compressed work week, overtime is paid for hours exceeding ten in a day or forty in a week.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type IN ['4x10_mon-thu', '10_on_4_off'] AND (daily_hours > 10 OR weekly_hours > 40) -> TRANSITION(OT)
reasoning: This rule specifies the daily and weekly overtime thresholds for a specific type of schedule, which is a core worked time calculation.

name: Overtime Qualification after Unexcused Absence
rule_text: Workers who are absent from work without pre-authorization, must work the minimum normal hours as stipulated above prior to overtime premiums being paid.
summary: After an unexcused absence, a worker must complete their full normal daily hours (8 or 10) before they can begin earning overtime pay.
logical_representation: IF is_absence_preauthorized (Unsupported) == false -> REQUIRE(WORK_MINIMUM_NORMAL_HOURS_BEFORE_OT)
reasoning: This rule creates a condition for earning overtime based on attendance, altering the standard overtime calculation and thus is a worked time rule.

name: Weekly Overtime Payability with Excusable Absences
rule_text: All overtime hours per the work week will be payable if the scheduled straight time hours and overtime hours are worked as per the work week schedule, excluding excusable absences hours missed.
summary: An employee will be paid for all weekly overtime hours if they worked all their scheduled hours, with an exception for missed time due to excusable absences.
logical_representation: IF is_absence_excusable (llm) == true -> CONSTRAINT(WEEKLY_OT_PAYABLE)
reasoning: This rule defines how absences affect the final calculation of weekly overtime pay, which is a key component of worked time administration.

name: Weekly Overtime Qualification with Unexcused Absences
rule_text: If scheduled straight time hours are missed due to unexcused absences the worker must work their straight time hours scheduled before overtime hours are earned.
summary: If a worker has an unexcused absence during the week, they must first make up the missed straight time hours before any subsequent hours are paid as overtime.
logical_representation: IF is_absence_excusable (llm) == false -> REQUIRE(WORK_SCHEDULED_ST_HOURS_BEFORE_OT)
reasoning: This rule establishes a 'make-up' requirement before weekly overtime is paid, directly altering the calculation and categorization of worked hours for the week.

name: Shift Work Penalty, Insufficient Duration
rule_text: Should each of the shifts outlined above not continue for a period of four (4) or five (5) consecutive working days, all hours worked shall be deemed overtime and paid at the applicable rates contained in this Agreement.
summary: If a shift schedule does not last for at least 5 consecutive days (or 4 for a 4x10 schedule), all hours worked on that shift must be paid as overtime.
logical_representation: IF (schedule_type == '5x8' AND shift_consecutive_days < 5) OR (schedule_type == '4x10' AND shift_consecutive_days < 4) -> PAY(ALL_HOURS_AS_OT)
reasoning: This rule directly dictates that time worked, which would normally be straight time, must be re-categorized and paid as overtime based on a specific condition.

name: Shift Work Penalty Waiver, Mutual Agreement
rule_text: By mutual agreement, shifts may be established for periods of less than four (4) or five (5) consecutive regular working days and in such an event, the deemed overtime that would otherwise be payable shall not apply.
summary: The penalty of paying all hours as overtime for short shifts (less than 4 or 5 days) can be waived if there is mutual agreement to establish the shorter shift period.
logical_representation: IF (shift_consecutive_days < 4 OR shift_consecutive_days < 5) AND is_mutual_agreement (llm) == true -> FORFEIT(ALL_HOURS_AS_OT_PENALTY)
reasoning: This rule provides an exception to a significant pay rule (the overtime penalty), thereby changing how hours are categorized and paid.

name: First Shift Overtime Thresholds
rule_text: The first shift shall work a normal shift as set out in Clause 16.01 and/or 17.01 of this Agreement, with the applicable overtime rate after eight (8) hours of work or in excess of ten (10) hours per day during a compressed work week.
summary: For the first shift, overtime rates apply after 8 hours on a standard workday or after 10 hours on a compressed work week day.
logical_representation: IF (schedule_type == '5x8' AND daily_hours > 8) OR (schedule_type == '4x10' AND daily_hours > 10) -> TRANSITION(OT)
reasoning: This rule defines the daily thresholds for when straight time ends and overtime begins, which is a fundamental aspect of categorizing worked time.

name: Alternate Shift Premium, Effective May 2025
rule_text: The hourly rate for Employees on any alternate shift(s) as outlined above shall be $4.00 per hour effective May 4 th , 2025 greater than the applicable day time rate of pay.
summary: Effective May 4, 2025, employees working on an alternate shift receive a premium of $4.00 per hour above their regular daytime rate.
logical_representation: IF shift_type == 'ALTERNATE' AND validity_start_date >= '2025-05-04' AND validity_end_date <= '2026-05-02' -> PREMIUM($4.00)
reasoning: This is a direct rule about a pay premium applied to hours worked under specific shift conditions, with a specific effective date.

name: Alternate Shift Premium, Effective May 2026
rule_text: The hourly rate for Employees on any alternate shift(s) as outlined above shall be ... ($4.50 effective May 3, 2026) greater than the applicable day time rate of pay.
summary: Effective May 3, 2026, the premium for employees on an alternate shift increases to $4.50 per hour above their regular daytime rate.
logical_representation: IF shift_type == 'ALTERNATE' AND validity_start_date >= '2026-05-03' -> PREMIUM($4.50)
reasoning: This is a direct rule about a pay premium applied to hours worked under specific shift conditions, with a specific effective date.

name: Alternate Shift Rate Cap
rule_text: In no event shall this hourly rate be greater than the applicable overtime rate plus shift differential.
summary: The total straight-time hourly rate for an alternate shift (base rate plus shift premium) cannot exceed the employee's applicable overtime rate plus the shift differential.
logical_representation: IF shift_type == 'ALTERNATE' -> CONSTRAINT(total_hourly_rate (llm) <= ot_rate (llm) + shift_differential (llm))
reasoning: This rule places a cap on the calculation of pay for worked time, which is a key part of labor time rules.

name: Irregular Single Shift Daily Overtime
rule_text: Overtime shall be payable on all hours in excess of eight (8) hours per day, or in excess of ten (10) hours per day during a compressed work week, and forty (40) hours per week and on Saturdays, Sundays, or Statutory Holidays.
summary: For irregular single shifts, overtime is paid for hours worked beyond 8 per day on a standard schedule, or beyond 10 per day on a compressed work week.
logical_representation: IF is_irregular_single_shift (Unsupported) == true AND ((schedule_type == '5x8' AND daily_hours > 8) OR (schedule_type == '4x10' AND daily_hours > 10)) -> TRANSITION(OT)
reasoning: This rule defines the daily overtime thresholds for a specific work condition.

name: Irregular Single Shift Weekly Overtime
rule_text: Overtime shall be payable on all hours in excess of eight (8) hours per day, or in excess of ten (10) hours per day during a compressed work week, and forty (40) hours per week and on Saturdays, Sundays, or Statutory Holidays.
summary: For irregular single shifts, overtime is paid for all hours worked beyond 40 in a week.
logical_representation: IF is_irregular_single_shift (Unsupported) == true AND weekly_hours > 40 -> TRANSITION(OT)
reasoning: This rule defines the weekly overtime threshold for a specific work condition.

name: Irregular Single Shift Weekend and Holiday Overtime
rule_text: Overtime shall be payable on all hours in excess of eight (8) hours per day, or in excess of ten (10) hours per day during a compressed work week, and forty (40) hours per week and on Saturdays, Sundays, or Statutory Holidays.
summary: For irregular single shifts, all hours worked on Saturdays, Sundays, or Statutory Holidays are paid as overtime.
logical_representation: IF is_irregular_single_shift (Unsupported) == true AND (day_of_week IN ['SAT', 'SUN'] OR is_stat_holiday == true) -> TRANSITION(OT)
reasoning: This rule categorizes all time worked on specific days as overtime.

name: Overtime Meal Entitlement after 10 Hours
rule_text: Where Employees are required to work in excess of ten (10) hours in a single shift, they shall be provided immediately after ten (10) hours, with a suitable meal (hot where possible) and every four (4) hours thereafter until the shift is ended.
summary: Employees who work more than 10 hours in a single shift must be provided with a meal immediately after the 10th hour, and another meal every 4 hours thereafter until the shift concludes.
logical_representation: IF daily_hours > 10 -> PROVIDE(meal) AND IF (daily_hours - 10) % 4 == 0 -> PROVIDE(meal)
reasoning: This rule establishes the primary trigger (working over 10 hours) for an employee to receive a meal, which is a core component of meal allowance entitlements.

name: Allowance When Meal Provision is Impractical
rule_text: On projects when it is impractical for the contractor to provide a meal the employee shall be paid a 15-minute paid break at the applicable rate of pay and the employer shall pay a meal allowance of $45.00 in lieu of the meal and the time to consume the meal.
summary: If it is impractical for the employer to provide a meal, the employee will receive a $45.00 meal allowance and a 15-minute paid break at their applicable pay rate instead.
logical_representation: IF daily_hours > 10 AND is_meal_provision_impractical (llm) == true -> PAY(0.25, applicable_rate) AND ALLOWANCE($45.00)
reasoning: This rule defines the specific monetary allowance and paid break provided as a substitute for a meal, directly relating to meal allowance policy.

name: Camp Accommodation Meal Exception
rule_text: Where a shift in excess of 10 hours but not longer than 12 hours is worked, when camp accommodations are provided and a full course hot supper is provided at the end of the shift, no meal allowance shall be payable.
summary: For shifts between 10 and 12 hours, if the employer provides camp accommodations and a full hot supper after the shift, no overtime meal allowance is required.
logical_representation: IF daily_hours > 10 AND daily_hours <= 12 AND camp_accommodations_provided (llm) == true AND hot_supper_provided (llm) == true -> FORFEIT(meal_allowance)
reasoning: This rule specifies conditions under which an employee is not entitled to a meal allowance, making it an exception rule within the meal allowance category.

name: Unscheduled Overtime Meal Grace Period
rule_text: Recognizing emergency or unplanned situations may arise intermittently, if the Contractor has not scheduled in excess of the ten (10) hour shift, the Contractor shall be granted a one (1) hour extension where the Contractor need not supply a hot meal or make payment in lieu of
summary: For unplanned or emergency overtime that extends a shift beyond 10 hours, the employer has a one-hour grace period (up to the 11th hour) where they are not required to provide a meal or pay an allowance.
logical_representation: IF is_shift_overtime_scheduled (llm) == false AND daily_hours > 10 AND daily_hours <= 11 -> FORFEIT(meal_allowance)
reasoning: This rule creates a specific exception to the meal allowance obligation based on the unplanned nature of the work, directly modifying meal allowance rules.

name: Paid Break During Unscheduled Overtime
rule_text: however; a fifteen (15) minute rest break paid at the applicable rate will be taken at the tenth (10 th ) hour.
summary: During the one-hour grace period for unscheduled overtime, employees must still receive a 15-minute paid rest break at their applicable rate at the 10-hour mark.
logical_representation: IF is_shift_overtime_scheduled (llm) == false AND daily_hours >= 10 -> PROVIDE(paid_break, 0.25, applicable_rate)
reasoning: This rule mandates a paid rest break, which is a component of compensated work time, and therefore falls under the category of labor worked time.

name: Maximum Hours without Overtime Meal
rule_text: Under no circumstance shall any Employee work more than eleven (11) hours without adherence to Clause 20.01.
summary: An employee cannot, under any circumstances, work more than 11 hours without the main overtime meal rule (20.01) being applied. The one-hour grace period for unplanned work cannot extend beyond this limit.
logical_representation: IF daily_hours > 11 -> APPLY_RULE('20.01')
reasoning: This rule sets a hard limit after which meal allowance provisions are mandatory, functioning as a final condition for meal allowance entitlement.

name: Supervisor Work Extension Meal Exception
rule_text: Where a supervisor is required to; (i) start up to one (1) hour earlier, or (ii) finish up to one (1) hour later, or (iii) start up to one half (½) hour earlier and finish up to one half (½) hour later than the supervisor's crew, for the purposes of organizing work or facilitating a transition to another shift, the provisions of 20.01 will not apply unless those provisions are applicable to the rest of the crew.
summary: If a supervisor works extra time (e.g., up to one hour early or late) for organizational duties, they are not entitled to overtime meals unless the rest of their crew also qualifies for them.
logical_representation: IF is_foreman == true AND supervisor_extra_hours (llm) <= 1 AND crew_meal_eligibility (llm) == false -> FORFEIT(meal_allowance)
reasoning: This rule provides a role-specific exemption from the standard meal allowance provisions, making it an exception rule within the meal allowance topic.

name: Industrial Local Resident Entitlement Exclusion (45-75km)
rule_text: INDUSTRIAL ONLY Local residents residing between a forty-five (45) km radius and a seventy-five (75) km radius of the job site shall not be entitled to receive initial and return travel allowance, room and board or subsistence, or camp accommodations, or rotational leave provisions
summary: On industrial projects, local residents living between 45 km and 75 km of the job site are not eligible for initial/return travel, room and board, subsistence, camp, or rotational leave benefits.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND is_local_resident (Unsupported) == true AND job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) > 45 AND job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) <= 75 -> FORFEIT(initial_return_travel) AND FORFEIT(room_and_board) AND FORFEIT(subsistence) AND FORFEIT(camp_accommodations) AND FORFEIT(rotational_leave)
reasoning: This rule explicitly removes entitlement to major subsistence and accommodation benefits for a specific group of workers, which is a core part of the subsistence allowance topic.

name: Industrial Local Resident Travel Allowance (45-75km)
rule_text: Local residents residing between a forty-five (45) km radius and a seventy-five (75) km radius of the job site... shall be paid a travel allowance of thirty-three dollars ($33.00) per day worked ($36.00 per day worked effective May 4/09) to cover transportation expenses and travel allowance
summary: On industrial projects, local residents living between 45 km and 75 km of the site receive a travel allowance of $33.00 per day worked, which increased to $36.00 per day worked effective May 4, 2009.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND is_local_resident (Unsupported) == true AND job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) > 45 AND job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) <= 75 AND validity_start_date >= '2009-05-04' -> ALLOWANCE($36.00/day_worked) | IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND is_local_resident (Unsupported) == true AND job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) > 45 AND job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) <= 75 AND validity_start_date < '2009-05-04' -> ALLOWANCE($33.00/day_worked)
reasoning: This rule provides a specific daily monetary allowance for travel, which is a form of subsistence compensation for non-camp-eligible workers.

name: Industrial Local Resident Travel Allowance with Employer Transport (45-75km)
rule_text: or if transportation is supplied by the Employer, a daily travel allowance of seventeen dollars ($17.00) ($19.00 per day worked effective May 4/09) will be paid for each day worked.
summary: On industrial projects, if the employer provides transportation for local residents living 45-75 km from the site, the daily travel allowance is reduced to $17.00, which increased to $19.00 effective May 4, 2009.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND is_local_resident (Unsupported) == true AND job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) > 45 AND job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) <= 75 AND transportation_provider (llm) == 'EMPLOYER' AND validity_start_date >= '2009-05-04' -> ALLOWANCE($19.00/day_worked) | IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND is_local_resident (Unsupported) == true AND job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) > 45 AND job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) <= 75 AND transportation_provider (llm) == 'EMPLOYER' AND validity_start_date < '2009-05-04' -> ALLOWANCE($17.00/day_worked)
reasoning: This rule modifies a daily travel allowance based on whether transportation is provided, directly relating to subsistence and travel compensation.

name: Local Resident Overtime Meal Entitlement
rule_text: Where a Local Resident Employee is required to work overtime, he shall be entitled to overtime meals in accordance with this Agreement.
summary: Local resident employees who work overtime are entitled to overtime meals as specified elsewhere in the collective agreement.
logical_representation: IF is_local_resident (Unsupported) == true AND daily_overtime_hours > 0 -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('OVERTIME_MEALS')
reasoning: This rule establishes eligibility for overtime meals, which is a key component of meal allowance regulations.

name: Union Membership Requirement (Industrial)
rule_text: General  Foremen,  Foremen,  Journeymen,  and  Apprentices  must  be  members  of  the appropriate Union.
summary: On Industrial projects, all General Foremen, Foremen, Journeymen, and Apprentices must be members of the appropriate union.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND (employee_class IN ['JOURNEYMAN', 'APPRENTICE'] OR is_foreman == true OR is_general_foreman (llm) == true) -> REQUIREMENT(UNION_MEMBERSHIP)
reasoning: This rule establishes a fundamental condition for employment and labor provision, which is a prerequisite for any time worked to be valid under the agreement. Therefore, it falls under the scope of rules governing worked time.

name: Foreman UA Certification Requirement (Industrial)
rule_text: It is further recognized that all the Steam Fitter-Pipe Fitter General Foremen and Foremen must be a UA certified Journeymen as designated by the Joint Educational Trust Fund Trustees.
summary: On Industrial projects, all Steam Fitter-Pipe Fitter General Foremen and Foremen must be UA certified Journeymen.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND position_classification == 'STEAM_FITTER_PIPE_FITTER' AND (is_foreman == true OR is_general_foreman (llm) == true) -> REQUIREMENT(UA_CERTIFIED_JOURNEYMAN)
reasoning: This rule defines a mandatory qualification for a specific role. Since this qualification is necessary for a person to hold a position and for their time to be billed at that position's rate, it is categorized under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Foreman Wage Premium (Industrial)
rule_text: The minimum rate of wages for a Foreman shall be $5.50 per hour above the basic UA Journeyman Industrial rates as listed in Article 8.01 of this Agreement.
summary: On Industrial projects, Foremen receive a minimum premium of $5.50 per hour above the basic Journeyman rate.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND is_foreman == true -> PREMIUM($5.50)
reasoning: This rule directly specifies a wage premium, which is a core component of how worked time is calculated and paid. It is a classic LABOR_WORKED_TIME rule.

name: General Foreman Wage Premium (Industrial)
rule_text: The minimum rate of wages for a General Foreman shall be $7.50 per hour, above the basic UA Journeyman Industrial rates as listed in Article 8.01 of this Agreement.
summary: On Industrial projects, General Foremen receive a minimum premium of $7.50 per hour above the basic Journeyman rate.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND is_general_foreman (llm) == true -> PREMIUM($7.50)
reasoning: This rule defines a specific wage premium for a role, directly impacting the calculation of labor costs for worked time.

name: ICCS Premium (Industrial)
rule_text: Foremen and General Foremen who are Industrial Construction Crew Supervisor (ICCS) designated will be paid additional premiums of one ($1.50) dollar and fifty cents per hour.
summary: On Industrial projects, Foremen and General Foremen with an ICCS designation receive an additional premium of $1.50 per hour.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND (is_foreman == true OR is_general_foreman (llm) == true) AND iccs_designated (llm) == true -> PREMIUM($1.50)
reasoning: This rule adds another layer to the wage calculation for specific individuals, making it a clear LABOR_WORKED_TIME rule.

name: Apprentice as Foreman Prohibition (Industrial)
rule_text: Apprentices shall not be elevated to the position of Foremen or be authorized to direct any portion of the working force.
summary: On Industrial projects, Apprentices cannot be promoted to Foreman or be authorized to supervise other workers.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND employee_class == 'APPRENTICE' -> CONSTRAINT(CANNOT_BE_FOREMAN)
reasoning: This rule restricts roles based on employee classification, which directly affects crew composition, supervision, and ultimately, labor costs. It's a rule about who can perform and bill for certain types of work time.

name: Foreman Supervision Ratio (Industrial)
rule_text: The average number of Journeymen under the supervision of a Foreman shall be twelve (12).
summary: On Industrial projects, the average number of Journeymen supervised by a single Foreman should be twelve.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' -> TARGET_RATIO(journeyman_count (llm) / foreman_count (llm) == 12)
reasoning: This rule defines staffing ratios, which are critical for determining the required number of supervisors for a given crew size. This directly impacts labor costs and is therefore classified under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Second Foreman Requirement (Industrial)
rule_text: The Employer agrees that there shall be two (2) Foremen once there are fourteen (14) Journeymen on the job.
summary: On Industrial projects, a second Foreman is required as soon as there are 14 Journeymen on the job.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND journeyman_count (llm) >= 14 -> REQUIREMENT(foreman_count (llm) >= 2)
reasoning: This is a specific, mandatory staffing rule triggered by the number of workers. It directly dictates the number of paid supervisors, impacting labor costs for worked time.

name: Welder Foreman Requirement at 15 Welders (Industrial)
rule_text: On projects requiring a minimum of fifteen (15) Welders; there shall be a Qualified 'A' or 'B' Welder employed as a Welder Foreman when fifteen (15) welders are employed.
summary: On Industrial projects with at least 15 welders, a qualified Welder Foreman must be employed.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND welder_count (llm) >= 15 -> REQUIREMENT(welder_foreman_count (llm) >= 1)
reasoning: This rule mandates the hiring of a specific supervisory role based on the number of trade-specific workers, directly impacting labor costs and crew composition.

name: Second Welder Foreman Requirement at 25 Welders (Industrial)
rule_text: An additional Welder Foreman will be employed when twenty-five (25) welders are employed
summary: On Industrial projects, a second Welder Foreman is required when 25 welders are employed.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND welder_count (llm) >= 25 -> REQUIREMENT(welder_foreman_count (llm) >= 2)
reasoning: This rule sets another specific threshold for adding supervisory staff, which directly affects the calculation of total labor cost for the project.

name: Subsequent Welder Foreman Ratio (Industrial)
rule_text: and  one  (1)  Welder  Foreman  for  every  twenty  (20)  Welders  employed  thereafter.
summary: On Industrial projects, after the first 25 welders, one additional Welder Foreman is required for every additional 20 welders.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND welder_count (llm) > 25 -> REQUIREMENT(welder_foreman_count (llm) >= 2 + FLOOR((welder_count (llm) - 25) / 20))
reasoning: This rule establishes a scalable staffing formula for supervision based on crew size, directly impacting labor costs. It is a core LABOR_WORKED_TIME rule.

name: Welder Foreman Training Preference (Industrial)
rule_text: Whenever  possible  such  Welder  Foreman  shall  have  taken  and  passed  the  'Welder Foreman Training Program' as developed between the Parties.
summary: Whenever possible, Welder Foremen on Industrial projects should have completed the 'Welder Foreman Training Program'.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND is_welder_foreman (llm) == true -> PREFERENCE(TRAINING_COMPLETED('Welder Foreman Training Program'))
reasoning: This rule specifies a preferred qualification for a role. While not a strict mandate ('whenever possible'), it sets a standard for the position which relates to the quality and cost of labor, thus falling under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Union Membership Requirement (Commercial/Institutional)
rule_text: General Foremen, Foremen, Journeymen and Apprentices must be members of the appropriate Union
summary: All General Foremen, Foremen, Journeymen, and Apprentices on Commercial or Institutional projects must be members of the appropriate union.
logical_representation: IF project_type IN ['COMMERCIAL', 'INSTITUTIONAL'] AND (employee_class IN ['JOURNEYMAN', 'APPRENTICE'] OR is_foreman == true OR is_general_foreman (llm) == true) -> REQUIREMENT(UNION_MEMBERSHIP)
reasoning: Similar to the Industrial rule, this establishes a fundamental condition for employment, making it a prerequisite for any worked time to be valid under the agreement.

name: Foreman Wage Premium (Commercial/Institutional - Local 488)
rule_text: The minimum rate of wages for a Foreman shall be $4.00 per hour and the minimum rate of wages for a General Foreman shall be $6.00 per hour, above the basic Journeyman rates as listed in Schedule 8.01 Commercial & Institutional Local 488 of this Agreement.
summary: For Commercial/Institutional projects under Local 488, Foremen receive a minimum premium of $4.00 per hour above the basic Journeyman rate.
logical_representation: IF project_type IN ['COMMERCIAL', 'INSTITUTIONAL'] AND is_foreman == true AND union_local (Unsupported) == '488' -> PREMIUM($4.00)
reasoning: This rule defines a specific wage premium based on role, project type, and union local, directly impacting the calculation of labor costs.

name: General Foreman Wage Premium (Commercial/Institutional - Local 488)
rule_text: The minimum rate of wages for a Foreman shall be $4.00 per hour and the minimum rate of wages for a General Foreman shall be $6.00 per hour, above the basic Journeyman rates as listed in Schedule 8.01 Commercial & Institutional Local 488 of this Agreement.
summary: For Commercial/Institutional projects under Local 488, General Foremen receive a minimum premium of $6.00 per hour above the basic Journeyman rate.
logical_representation: IF project_type IN ['COMMERCIAL', 'INSTITUTIONAL'] AND is_general_foreman (llm) == true AND union_local (Unsupported) == '488' -> PREMIUM($6.00)
reasoning: This rule defines a specific wage premium based on role, project type, and union local, directly impacting the calculation of labor costs.

name: Foreman Wage Premium (Commercial/Institutional - Local 496)
rule_text: The minimum rate of wages for a Foreman shall be $3.00 per hour and the minimum rate of wages for a General Foreman shall be $6.00 per hour, above the basic Journeyman rates as listed in Schedule 8.01 Commercial & Institutional Local 496 of this Agreement
summary: For Commercial/Institutional projects under Local 496, Foremen receive a minimum premium of $3.00 per hour above the basic Journeyman rate.
logical_representation: IF project_type IN ['COMMERCIAL', 'INSTITUTIONAL'] AND is_foreman == true AND union_local (Unsupported) == '496' -> PREMIUM($3.00)
reasoning: This rule defines a specific wage premium based on role, project type, and union local, directly impacting the calculation of labor costs.

name: General Foreman Wage Premium (Commercial/Institutional - Local 496)
rule_text: The minimum rate of wages for a Foreman shall be $3.00 per hour and the minimum rate of wages for a General Foreman shall be $6.00 per hour, above the basic Journeyman rates as listed in Schedule 8.01 Commercial & Institutional Local 496 of this Agreement
summary: For Commercial/Institutional projects under Local 496, General Foremen receive a minimum premium of $6.00 per hour above the basic Journeyman rate.
logical_representation: IF project_type IN ['COMMERCIAL', 'INSTITUTIONAL'] AND is_general_foreman (llm) == true AND union_local (Unsupported) == '496' -> PREMIUM($6.00)
reasoning: This rule defines a specific wage premium based on role, project type, and union local, directly impacting the calculation of labor costs.

name: Apprentice as Foreman Prohibition (Commercial/Institutional)
rule_text: Apprentices shall not be elevated to the position of Foremen.
summary: On Commercial or Institutional projects, Apprentices cannot be promoted to Foreman.
logical_representation: IF project_type IN ['COMMERCIAL', 'INSTITUTIONAL'] AND employee_class == 'APPRENTICE' -> CONSTRAINT(CANNOT_BE_FOREMAN)
reasoning: This rule restricts roles based on employee classification, which affects crew composition and labor costs, placing it within the LABOR_WORKED_TIME topic.

name: Foreman Supervision Ratio (Commercial/Institutional)
rule_text: The average number of Journeymen under the supervision of a Foreman shall be twelve (12).
summary: On Commercial or Institutional projects, the average number of Journeymen supervised by a single Foreman should be twelve.
logical_representation: IF project_type IN ['COMMERCIAL', 'INSTITUTIONAL'] -> TARGET_RATIO(journeyman_count (llm) / foreman_count (llm) == 12)
reasoning: This rule defines staffing ratios, which are critical for determining the required number of supervisors for a given crew size. This directly impacts labor costs and is therefore classified under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Commercial/Institutional Daily Travel Beyond Free Zone
rule_text: For projects beyond the forty-five kilometre (45 km) free zone for which daily travel is required, then the Employer will provide transportation, plus a travel allowance to be negotiated in consultation with the Union, however, in the event no Agreement is reached with the Union then a decision shall be made by the Registered Employers' Organization, which decision shall be final and binding.
summary: For Commercial/Institutional projects beyond the 45 km free zone, the employer must provide transportation and a travel allowance. The allowance amount is negotiated with the Union, with a final decision made by the Employers' Organization if no agreement is reached.
logical_representation: IF (project_type == 'COMMERCIAL' OR project_type == 'INSTITUTIONAL') AND project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) > 45 -> PROVIDE(transportation) AND ALLOWANCE(negotiated_travel_allowance)
reasoning: This rule mandates the provision of transportation and a monetary allowance for travel, which are core components of subsistence and travel entitlements.

name: Subsistence on Statutory Holidays
rule_text: Board and room will be supplied, or the daily expense allowance will be paid for any Statutory Holiday which falls on a scheduled workday other than a first or last day of a scheduled shift provided the Employee reports for work on the workday immediately preceding and following the Statutory Holiday.
summary: Subsistence or room and board is provided for a statutory holiday if it falls on a scheduled workday (and is not the first or last day of the shift) and the employee works the scheduled days immediately before and after the holiday.
logical_representation: IF is_stat_holiday == true AND is_first_or_last_day_of_shift (llm) == false AND worked_day_before_and_after (llm) == true -> ALLOWANCE(daily_subsistence)
reasoning: This rule specifies the conditions for receiving a daily living allowance on a statutory holiday, making it a subsistence rule.

name: Subsistence Forfeiture for Unexcused Absences
rule_text: Employees failing to report for work on the workday immediately preceding and following a weekend or Statutory Holiday will receive the above for days worked only.
summary: For jobs beyond 475km, if an employee has an unexcused absence on the workday before or after a weekend or statutory holiday, they will only receive subsistence for the days they actually worked, forfeiting it for the days off.
logical_representation: IF worked_day_before_and_after (llm) == false -> FORFEIT(subsistence_for_weekend_or_stat)
reasoning: This rule outlines conditions for forfeiture of a living allowance based on attendance, which directly relates to subsistence rules.

name: Prorated Subsistence for Early Departure
rule_text: If an Employee who is being provided with subsistence allowance chooses to leave a jobsite prior to the normal quitting time without receiving consent from their Employer, the Employee will receive a prorated amount of subsistence based upon the number of hours the Employee worked in the workday, compared to the regularly scheduled hours of work for the day. If the Employee leaves prior to the normal quitting time with the consent of the Employer they will receive the normal daily subsistence allowance for that day.
summary: An employee who leaves work early without permission will have their daily subsistence allowance prorated based on hours worked. If they leave early with permission, they receive the full day's subsistence.
logical_representation: IF is_absence_preauthorized (Unsupported) == false -> PRORATED(subsistence, daily_hours / scheduled_daily_hours (llm)) ELSE ALLOWANCE(full_daily_subsistence)
reasoning: This rule dictates how a daily monetary allowance is calculated based on attendance and hours worked, which falls under subsistence.

name: Commercial/Institutional Out-of-Town Options (within 475km)
rule_text: Where Employees are employed in the area beyond that in which daily travel applies and up to a radius of 475 km from the center of the cities of Edmonton or Calgary... the Employer may elect to provide:  camp accommodations... or  mutually agreed room and board; or  subsistence allowance as follows: An amount to be negotiated...
summary: For Commercial/Institutional work beyond daily travel zones but within 475km, the employer can provide camp, agreed room and board, or a negotiated subsistence allowance.
logical_representation: IF (project_type == 'COMMERCIAL' OR project_type == 'INSTITUTIONAL') AND project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) > 45 AND project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) <= 475 -> EMPLOYER_CHOICE(PROVIDE(camp), PROVIDE(room_and_board), ALLOWANCE(negotiated_subsistence))
reasoning: This rule specifies the employer's options for providing living-out entitlements, which is the definition of subsistence.

name: Commercial/Institutional Out-of-Town Options (beyond 475km)
rule_text: Beyond a 475 kilometer radius from the center of the cities of Edmonton or Calgary, as may be appropriate, the Employer, where their Employees do not return daily, has the same elections as above, but on the basis of seven (7) days per week.
summary: For Commercial/Institutional work beyond 475km where employees do not return home daily, the employer has the same options (camp, room and board, or negotiated subsistence) but must provide them on a 7-day-per-week basis.
logical_representation: IF (project_type == 'COMMERCIAL' OR project_type == 'INSTITUTIONAL') AND project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) > 475 -> EMPLOYER_CHOICE(PROVIDE(camp), PROVIDE(room_and_board), ALLOWANCE(negotiated_subsistence)) ON(7_day_basis)
reasoning: This rule defines the provision of living-out entitlements for long-distance projects, which is a core subsistence rule.

name: Initial and Return Transportation Allowance - Industrial
rule_text: Employees directed or dispatched to a project/jobsite from which they do not return daily shall be paid travel allowance for initial travel and transportation to the project and return, upon termination of the job or their employment, based upon a radius from the cities of Edmonton or Calgary, as applicable, as follows: (i) up to 200 kilometres - $$$ each way; (ii) 200 kilometres to 300 kilometres - $$$ each way; (iii) 300 kilometres to 375 kilometres - $$$ each way; (iv) over 375 kilometres to 475 kilometres $$$ each way, or actual airfare... (vi) over 475 kilometres - as mutually agreed...
summary: For industrial jobs where employees don't return daily, they receive a fixed initial and return travel allowance. The amount is tiered based on the project's distance from Edmonton or Calgary.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' -> CASE project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) [ <= 200 -> ALLOWANCE($X), 201-300 -> ALLOWANCE($Y), ... ] FOR(initial_and_return_trip)
reasoning: This rule provides a monetary allowance to cover the costs of travel to and from a remote site, which is a form of subsistence or travel entitlement.

name: Rotational Leave and Allowance (300-475km) - Industrial
rule_text: On jobs located beyond a Three Hundred (300) km radius to a maximum of Four Hundred and Seventy-five (475) km from the centre of Edmonton or Calgary or other hiring hall location, the Employer shall: (i) Pay an allowance...after thirty-five (35) calendar days of employment on the job and thereafter for each subsequent thirty-five (35) calendar days of employment on the job. (ii) Allow employees five (5) working days leave...
summary: For industrial jobs between 300km and 475km, after every 35 calendar days of employment, the employee is entitled to a monetary allowance and five working days of leave.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) > 300 AND project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) <= 475 AND days_on_job (llm) % 35 == 0 -> ALLOWANCE(turnaround_$$$) AND PROVIDE(5_days_leave)
reasoning: This rule provides for a periodic monetary allowance and leave for employees on remote job sites, which is a form of subsistence or remote work incentive.

name: Rotational Leave and Allowance (>475km) - Industrial
rule_text: On jobs located beyond a four hundred and seventy-five (475) kilometre radius from the centre of Edmonton or Calgary or other hiring hall location, the Employer shall: (i) Provide a negotiated transportation allowance, not to exceed scheduled airline air fare where scheduled air service is available, or pay an allowance...where airline service is not available, after thirty-five (35) calendar days... (ii) Allow employees five (5) working days leave...
summary: For industrial jobs beyond 475km, after every 35 calendar days, the employee is entitled to five working days of leave and a transportation allowance (not to exceed airfare if available) or a standard allowance if not.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) > 475 AND days_on_job (llm) % 35 == 0 -> ALLOWANCE(negotiated_turnaround_$$$) AND PROVIDE(5_days_leave)
reasoning: This rule provides for a periodic monetary allowance and leave for employees on very remote job sites, falling under subsistence and remote work incentives.

name: Rotational Leave Allowance (Commercial/Institutional)
rule_text: For COMMERCIAL and INSTITUTIONAL Work, the allowance for the Turnaround Leave is to be negotiated between the Employer and the Union. (based on the Industrial format in Clause 29.07(a)(i)&(b)(i)), however in the event that no agreement is reached between the Employer and the Union a decision shall be made by the Registered Employers Organization, which decision shall be final and binding.
summary: For Commercial and Institutional projects, the rotational leave (turnaround) allowance is negotiated between the employer and the union. If they cannot agree, the Employers' Organization will make a final and binding decision.
logical_representation: IF (project_type == 'COMMERCIAL' OR project_type == 'INSTITUTIONAL') -> SET(turnaround_allowance) BY(negotiation_or_decision)
reasoning: This rule specifies the process for determining the amount of a monetary allowance for remote work, which falls under the category of subsistence.

name: Letter of Understanding Validity Period
rule_text: Whereas the Parties have entered into a Collective Agreement which shall remain in effect from May 4th, 2025 through April 30, 2029... This Letter of Understanding shall terminate with the expiry of this Collective Agreement...
summary: This Letter of Understanding, which governs the creation of Special Project Needs Agreements (SPNAs), is valid from May 4, 2025, to April 30, 2029.
logical_representation: SET_AGREEMENT_VALIDITY(start: '2025-05-04', end: '2029-04-30')
reasoning: This rule establishes the effective date range for the entire agreement that governs the creation of project-specific labor rules (SPNAs), which primarily concern work time.

name: SPNA Effective Date
rule_text: Upon completion of the process set out herein, unless the Arbitration Panel rules otherwise, the SPNA shall become effective on the 31 st day after the SPNA is received from the Chair of the Coordinating Committee.
summary: Unless an arbitration decision states otherwise, a Special Project Needs Agreement (SPNA) automatically becomes effective 31 days after it is received from the Chair of the Coordinating Committee.
logical_representation: IF arbitration_ruling_exists (llm) == false -> SET(validity_start_date = spna_receipt_date (llm) + 31_days)
reasoning: This rule defines the start date for the applicability of a specific set of labor rules (the SPNA), which directly governs work time calculations from that point forward.

name: SPNA Continuity After Agreement Expiry
rule_text: This Letter of Understanding shall terminate with the expiry of this Collective Agreement, provided, however, that any SPNA established under this Letter of Understanding shall continue for the term provided therein.
summary: Even after the main Letter of Understanding expires, any Special Project Needs Agreement (SPNA) that was established under it will remain in effect for its own specified term.
logical_representation: IF validity_end_date (of LOU) is reached AND SPNA_is_active -> SPNA_REMAINS_VALID_UNTIL(spna_term_end_date (llm))
reasoning: This rule ensures the continuity of project-specific labor work time rules beyond the expiration of the parent agreement, guaranteeing stable conditions for the project's duration.
